content:
Posted: December 14, 2015
												A short game, Estranged: Act 1 delivers a compelling performance of a fisherman, who gets stranded on an island during a storm. You meet several people: some good, some very bad, who will help or hurt you as you go along your path. The game is made on the source engine, and uses many of the Half-Life elements and features from it. Being a free-to-play game, I entered this game not expecting much but a few cheap dialogs and meaningless character development for the sake of it only being the first of the series. Surprisingly, the game delivered more than what it offered, such as an enticing tale of a man's struggle to help those who he encoutered and also kicking a few butts along the way. The game abruptly ends though, leaving the want for Act 2 to come fairly soon. I was honestly suprised by all of the elements in this game, as well as most of the visuals being such great quality. If you do try this game, I hope you enjoyed it as much as I did.

Posted: January 17, 2014
												One of the main things I have to say about this mod is that it's music is really good at setting the mood/atmosphere for the game. Without it I think my opinion of the game would have been very different. Its a short exploration "horror" game (has a few attempted jump scares and tries to build up a very spooky setting. Its nothing amazing but does what it sets out to do fairly well and completed the game with a positive view on it in the end.Most of the achievements are there to reward exploration, but it has two achievements that require you to beat it in a certain way and the good thing is that both of those can be done at the same time. One of them feels like a homage to the classic rocket man achievement from Half-Life 2: Episode 2 or the Guardin' Gnome from L4D2.Time to 100%: 2½ hours

content:
Posted: June 1, 2015
 My Review :  Rate  : 7/10 Game Information :Title : Estranged: Act IEngine : SourceGenre : Adventure, Free to Play, Indie, Single Player, FPSPlatforms : Windows, Mac, LinuxDeveloper : Alan Edwardes Release Date : 16 Jan, 2014Estranged: Act I is a free Half Life 2 mod made using Source Engine. Its a pretty good mod and has amazing environment. Its free mod and you need to figure your way out by solving simple puzzles. I recommend it to all Half Life fans as it has a similar environment and puzzles.Pros : ● HL2 Mod but like a standalone game.● Source engine graphics.● Bit of horror when you are around zombies and enemies.● 8 simple steam achievements and one carry till the end achievement. Cons :● No boss fights.● Few types of enemies. ● I didn't enjoy the ending. :(● Human Enemies can kill you instantly.● Some maps are laggy and crashes sometimes. ● Bad lighting effects at some places like vents where you can see light rays behind the wall. Verdict : Its free so its worth playing, but let me remind you something. It is an episodic game so you'll have to wait for the next episode. It's not perfect and awesome game but as a standalone mod, it has potential.

												Estranged: Act I is a free to play game which is a plus to the game since the game don't really explain what to do and where to go and you then find yourself doing loops and doing the same things. The game is very confusing but the story lines get better the more you progress through the game. The atmosphere of the game is pretty intense. The game does give some good gameplay, but the registrations could be a bit better and the overall game could be more solid. The music that plays is also pretty good. It has some tense and creepy music, that gives the levels a dynamic eerie feel to the game, which is a bonus for a game that tries to give the scary feeling, which i think is half achieved. Although the game feels half finished, you can get some fun from this game, and the more time you put into the game, the better it is. The level design is good and it is generally a well half built game.

number of helpful: 7 of 7 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 23, 2014
												This "Addon" for Half-Life 2 is very cool. It has its own story and voice acting, own models and textures.Story:The story in Estranged: Act 1 is'nt that large, 90% of the game you're by youself. You can find newspapers and other things on computers telling you about what has happened. The story is'nt set in the Half-Life world, which makes them have many new things to try.Character:The characters in Estranged: Act 1 have wonderful voice acting. The characters seem to give emotion to the player. The models for the humans arn't new, they are the same old citizen models. But for the zombies, they are new. The models arn't that bad, and also the zombies have a new animation. The animation is pretty good, but always room for improvement.Models:The new models in Estranged: Act 1 are well made. The models fit right in with the Half-Life 2 style. The new zombie, barrel and other models are fantastic. The new models give a new feel to the game, making a new experience for the player.Textures:The new textures in Estranged: Act 1 are also well made. The look realistic and fit in with the Half-Life 2 textures. The new textures arn't only on the new models though, they are also on the floors, wall and roof.Conclusion:In conculsion Estranged: Act 1 is a well made Addon for Half-Life 2. Even though the game is short, i recomend this addon for people who have Half-Life 2 already. It's not worth buy Half-Life 2 just for this addon because it's just to short.This Game (Addon) gets a 8.5/10Sorry for any spelling mistakes in this review.

number of helpful: 6 of 6 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 23
												First off, this game was gorgeous to look at. It does its best to be pleasing to the eye however the age old Source Engine can. The Art direction was really nice. Reminded me of Silent Hill mixed with a bit of F.E.A.R, two of my favourite horror titles. The lighting in this game is some of the best I've seen. I liked the amber bounce lighting the flashlight emitted. The game is quick to build atmospher and quick to change it up which, along with its linear levels (which I loved), made it a really enjoyable 1 hour 45 mins of playtime. The combat was also refreshing and often times tactical. Furthermore, the puzzles were simple but enjoyable, although often times too short and too obvious. This wouldn't have been a problem if the combat was a huge aspect of this game but unfortunately there's not much going on. Besides that, It was only an hour and 45 minutes long but that doesn't matter since the time spent playing was a blast and let's not forget that the product is FREE! High Production Value, Good Stuff. Worth your time!

number of helpful: 7 of 8 people (88%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 27, 2014
												Estranged Act I is a free-to-play game made with the Source engine and because it's free you can't really complain, right ? 'Because the best things in life are free', is what they say. I just hope this is not one of those things.I have to admit that I'm being a bit harsh here, because the game isn't bad at all. It's just uneventful, and while it only lasts about 75 minutes it unsuccessfully managed to pull me in. The puzzles are basic and simple, and physics based, and the combat boring. There's also not enough variety as far as the environments are concerned (the start and end of the game are the only exceptions if you ask me). Look at me, bashing a free game. I should be ashamed. I am a bit actually because at least someone made some effort to try and produce a game. Yes, it's flawed and there's plenty of room for improvements, but I honestly think you should give it a try and judge it for yourself. You have nothing to lose except for a couple of lost hours maybe.[Rating: 68/100]

content:
Posted: July 21, 2015
												*SPOILERS* Great game! This game is a mod for Half-Life 2, so when you play through this game, you'll notice some of the same objects and textures that were in that game. Plus, Isaac Kleiner is a cameo in this game! The story is pretty nice but it's a little strange how an ordinary fisherman goes from a confused and estranged person from the rest of the world and comes to this island supposedly, and not even 10 minutes into the game, you're given a gun and you're already killin' zombies. Well, I can't blame them for making this guy directly becoming rambo, I mean afterall it's just a mod for Half-Life 2. Aside from that, the level design is great, the voice acting is also pretty good. Unfortunately, I did encounter some glitches. One of them is when you are given your first gun from the guy at the house near the boat and you continue walking out the house, he out of nowhere disapeares. Or when you go into the doorway past the shooting gallery to walk up the stairs, you get a loading screen and if you jump all the way down from the stairs again, the door where you came from is a brick wall with a door frame. But the only way you can see these glitches is if you just walk around everywhere. Another thing that I didn't really like was the ending, it was a little illogical but some people might be fun with this ending and some people might not. But look, it's a free game on steam so it wouldn't bother than if I had to pay for this game. If I did have to buy this game, I would expect this game to be longer. Totally recommend it for anyone who doesn't have any money on steam. 7/10

content:
Posted: June 17, 2016
												So, I have a lot to say about this game. First off, this game is GREAT. At first I thought this would be nothing but a Zombie-Shooting game, but I was wrong. Estranged: Act 1 is filled with beautiful graphics, an interesting storyline, and an intense atmosphere which always keeps you on edge. I loved the plotline, especially learning about Arque. Fun and optional things, such as being able to read the newspaper and interact with computers, only increases the feeling of being in a real-world environment. The only problem I had was Dr. Richmond walking really, REALLY slowly. I know this is because of Kliener's A.I., but it would have been nice not having to wait that extra bit for him to walk up the stairs. All things considered, this mod deserves a solid 9.5/10. I can't wait for Estranged: Act 2, and to return to the amazing world that the creators  have made.

												A standalone Source engine game, Estranged: Act I attempts to create a unique storyline with breathtaking details. Originally a mod for Half-Life 2: Episode Two, Estranged has finally been released onto Steam as a standalone game, so you don't need any other games in order to play it. number of helpful: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 9, 2016
												This is a free Half Life 2 mod with an interesting story - we play as a fisherman who gets stranded on an island after receiving a mysterious distress call. Naturally, we investigate and soon encounter the enemies in the small town nearby. Alan and his team took the effort to include a lot of new assets as well as new effects in the game. At times it's beautiful and it's difficult to believe the engine is more than 10 years old. The accompanying music at various sequences is also great. Initially, the game starts out as a horror story but later on the creators include more puzzle and action sequences. The only downside with Estranged is that it is - at this point - unfinished. Only Act 1 is available which can be completed in a mere 2 hours with all of its chapters. And whilst this was released more than 2 years ago I understand from various forum posts that Act 2 is in still progress - due to different circumstances, however, the development process has slowed down.If you do not mind playing an unfinished mod (that may never see its sequel) then Estranged is a good purchase. For me it is on par with Transmission and I consider it a great example as to what mods should be released from time to time.

content:
Posted: January 22, 2014
												Was a good game (mod ?) based on HL2's source engine. It's really valve-like, you have one precise path to take, you encounter many "use-your-brain-to-figure-out-how-to-get-out-of-here" parts and  you live each single event through the character's eyes. The scenario is good (from what we know till here) and there are many fun things such as cute cat videos and the fact that they used Dr. Kleiner as a totally random scientist in the game ! Moreover it has fun achievements. ^^ Bon jeu, basé sur le "source engine" de HL2. Typique du jeu Valve, un chemin précis à prendre, beacoup d'endroits ou il faut réfléchir pour trouver une solution, et on vit tous les evenements à travers les yeux du perso. Le scenar est bon (de ce qu'on en sait jusque là) et il y a pas mal de trucs marrant style des videos de chats et le fait qu'ils aient réutilisé le Dr. Kleiner pour en faire un scientifique completement sans relation avec l'original.En plus les succes sont simples et marrants. ^^

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 21, 2015
												Where's the 2nd act?! Estranged puts the player in a very alien environment with no backstory and lets the player deduce exactly what's going on with this island that you have crash landed at. The game precedes to take you through several situations in which you need to problem solve and find the best way out to survive, while providing some varying locations  and an interesting dynamic of storytelling through meeting other characters or even small things like reading the e-mail of an absent Arque employee. All of this enjoyment basically comes to an abrupt halt though with the game's ending. It provides an effective cliffhanger, but the only problem with having a cliffhanger is eventually finishing your story and provide closure for the player. This, sadly, has not been done by the creators of this game. Besides that, the game's visual presentation is done very well and makes the Half Life 2 engine definitely a force to be reckoned with. Great and thrilling experience, this game definitely warrants a sequel. I mean..... I enjoyed what this game had to offer a lot more than the original Half Life and if that doesn't say something, I don't know what does.

content:
Posted: November 2, 2016
												I was mighty impressed with how the developers of this game/Half Life 2 mod designed their levels, gave hints with light and things dropping to draw attention, nice details, great sound design, music and voice acting. Having objectives, the occasional little puzzle, weapons, enemies & locales switching on a regular basis made for a thoroughly enjoyable couple of hours! Plus it has some genuine good humour!Sure, the concept isn't groundbreaking, many a story has had a similair start, and there a "zombies" and "soldiers". But the use of the source engine is epic. Of course, you will have the familiar issue of grabbing a chair when meaning to grab a battery and subsequently smashing said chair all over the room with clinking and clanking, but hey. It could be worse. AI is good, and facial animations and lip synching as well. I was pleasanlty surprised because I so seldom come across NPC's with voice acting and facial animations in small scale FP horror games. Now I don't know enough about modding to tell if that's inherent in the models and engine of Half Life 2, or if it needs to be created, calculated, programmed or calibrated for the mod to work, but fact is it is a nice end result in either case.When I finished Act 1, I was really pumped to continue on and get to the conclusion of this story. It certainly ends on a cliffhanger!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 8, 2014
												This was very enjoyable to play through. It sets the mood of a survival horror game without plastering the game with zombies. The zombies weren't my biggest worry though. Act 1 showed a lot of creativity. Throughout the game, there was a lot of empty rooms to explore. I kept thinking that the developers could have put a few supplies in them because I almost stopped exploring the rooms - but then again, it turns out I didn't need the supplies, and the empty rooms had a lot of fun little quirks in them (billboard with notes from staff meetings or computers with poorly written e-mails).I liked the fact that you could only carry one weapon at a time. There wasn't many options to actually choose between more than one weapon, but I'd like to see that expanded further in Act 2. After all, it doesn't really make sense that a random fisherman can carry 2 guns, 2 automated machine guns, a shotgun, 5 grenades, a railgun and a rocket launcher, does it? ;)I am very much looking forward to Act 2!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 17, 2014
												When I saw the screenshots, I was hoping it'd be one of these adventure games where you don't shoot your way to end, but rather taking your time explorating and stuff like that.Only for me to be little mislead... well you don't really gun your way out until later on in game, and it doesn't really last long (nor  hard, it's fairly easy as you play it carefully) but the starting is really good in eerie way, and the graphics are pretty great.  For deaf gamers, you'll be glad it has closed captions, but then again this is Half Life 2 mod and Half Life 2 games has been amazing for those who are deaf / hard of hearing. Overall, if I'd have to be bluntly honest, it's nothing too special but personally as it was free, and I had fun of three hours (two playthroughs, one natural another achievements) and the story (from what there is anyway) seems pretty decent, although I'd assume Act II is when it shines.So yeah, if you happen to enjoy adventure games with little amount of gunplay and mainly exploration/the story, give it a try at least. It's free, so it's not hurting your wallet anyway.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 25, 2015
												Estranged is a really good source mod for Half Life 2.  (Just Saying...)The Story: is about a dimwit like you crashes a boat and goes into a little town. Meet a couple of british and american people and boom you're done. (2 Hours Of Game Time)The Gameplay: isn't really nothing at all. It's still killing zombies and humans with weapons and hammers. There's also one slot for weapons which is a damn pain in tha♥♥♥♥♥ I tried to open a vent (SPOILER!!!) when me and this guy called george told me to go to the lighthouse or town or something. I couldn't even open the facking vent. If I had the hammer with me instead of nocliping into the vent, It would've been easier. There is guns in the game and you need health when you get hit by people and zombies. You also need batteries for your flashlight too, but you don't really need it if you turn the brightness up a bit. (You can get a achivement from it too) This makes you want to explore! And look behind box's and look behind every nook and cranny and door. It's really gewd.If you seen the title, this game has "Acts". (Chapters) Keep in mind that the game is two hours long.Graphics: look sorta good. When you go to the offices in the game, it looks pretty good. ! It looks like Stanley Parable graphics. !Verdict: is that the game is okay and good at the same time. It has its up and downs but still is a very good source mod. I still can't wait for Act 2! (If they even make one.)Rating (7.8/10)

content:
Posted: January 25, 2015
												Estranged is a really good source mod for Half Life 2.  (Just Saying...)The Story: is about a dimwit like you crashes a boat and goes into a little town. Meet a couple of british and american people and boom you're done. (2 Hours Of Game Time)The Gameplay: isn't really nothing at all. It's still killing zombies and humans with weapons and hammers. There's also one slot for weapons which is a damn pain in tha♥♥♥♥♥ I tried to open a vent (SPOILER!!!) when me and this guy called george told me to go to the lighthouse or town or something. I couldn't even open the facking vent. If I had the hammer with me instead of nocliping into the vent, It would've been easier. There is guns in the game and you need health when you get hit by people and zombies. You also need batteries for your flashlight too, but you don't really need it if you turn the brightness up a bit. (You can get a achivement from it too) This makes you want to explore! And look behind box's and look behind every nook and cranny and door. It's really gewd.If you seen the title, this game has "Acts". (Chapters) Keep in mind that the game is two hours long.Graphics: look sorta good. When you go to the offices in the game, it looks pretty good. ! It looks like Stanley Parable graphics. !Verdict: is that the game is okay and good at the same time. It has its up and downs but still is a very good source mod. I still can't wait for Act 2! (If they even make one.)Rating (7.8/10)

content:
Posted: January 17, 2014
												When I saw the screenshots, I was hoping it'd be one of these adventure games where you don't shoot your way to end, but rather taking your time explorating and stuff like that.Only for me to be little mislead... well you don't really gun your way out until later on in game, and it doesn't really last long (nor  hard, it's fairly easy as you play it carefully) but the starting is really good in eerie way, and the graphics are pretty great.  For deaf gamers, you'll be glad it has closed captions, but then again this is Half Life 2 mod and Half Life 2 games has been amazing for those who are deaf / hard of hearing. Overall, if I'd have to be bluntly honest, it's nothing too special but personally as it was free, and I had fun of three hours (two playthroughs, one natural another achievements) and the story (from what there is anyway) seems pretty decent, although I'd assume Act II is when it shines.So yeah, if you happen to enjoy adventure games with little amount of gunplay and mainly exploration/the story, give it a try at least. It's free, so it's not hurting your wallet anyway.

content:
Posted: May 19, 2014
												Estranged: Act I is a Half-Life 2 mod that has been developed using the Valve Source Engine. Half-Life 2 is not required to play this game. In Estranged, you play the role of a lone fisherman whose ship crashes during a bad storm. You end up on a mysterious island which seems to be abandon, or so you think. An outbreak of an unknown zombie-like virus has occurred on the island leaving you with very little ways to find help. This horror game will allow you to uncover facts about what has happened as you try and find your way back to the mainland.I personally have earned every achievement in the game along with completing it. I had a lot of fun earning all the achievements along with playing the game itself. Yes, this is a horror game. I can tell you there are a few parts in the game that  are considered jumpscares, small ones though, it all depends on how you view them. Don't worry though, if you're not the type for horror games, I recommend trying Estranged: Act I. You should find that the story in the game is very interesting and that the developers put a lot of effort into making this mod. There are parts where there is a lot of shooting action, but it shouldn't be too hard for anyone. The puzzles in this game are simple to figure out, I did not find one puzzle during my playthrough in which I was stuck on for a while. Overall, this is the best Half-Life 2 mod I have ever played. This game is like a story book, but instead of reading, you are actually playing it virtually. The developers put a lot of time and effort into creating this game, and I can't wait until they release Estranged: Act II. If you have some free time, try this game! It's free, and it will keep you occupied for a good amount of time, it only took me about 2-3 hours to complete the whole game, but that was because I was taking my time and exploring a lot.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 24, 2016
												Estranged Act I is the first part of a horror story involving a fisherman's quest for survival and answers after being washed ashore on a small island. The island is very reminiscent of a small New England town. Expect monsters, simple puzzle solving (HL-style manipulation), compelling story, good game play (including the appropriate use of swimming), good soundtrack, and engaging visuals. The use of graffiti on old industrial complexes and the newspapers seen in passing help give the gamer a real feel for the area.Atmosphere is key and Estranged pulls off tension and mood perfectly.  The achievements are a mixed bag. To get 100% you'll need to change the way you approach the game: one achievement has you literally carrying a bucket through entire game while you’re not attacking foes or using objects. They’re generally fun. Read the achievement list prior to playing if that's something that matters to you, they aren't unlocked instinctively. From what the developers have released, we should be seeing Act II soon. The new game should be based off the Unreal engine instead of the visually and mechanically limiting Source engine. This is an awesome time to get in on the action.

content:
Posted: March 15, 2016
												Completely free linear FPS in the Source engine. Sticks to the Half-Life nuances very loyally, right down to the trains.The environment has a lot of attention to detail. Everything feels very immersive and interesting. The game exhibits a very forboding atmosphere throughout and keeps you going/interested in uncovering the next portion on your steps to civilization. The combat is simple, but it's at the level that works best for the game. I wish that the game was longer, but given the level of detail and satisfaction from the little time I spent with this game, I could tell that the game length is not a result of the developer's laziness. I would have paid money for this, honestly.Unfortunately, as a Source engine fanboy, I'm sad to know that Act II will be created on the Unreal Engine, but it should all still be great. This developer is very active with the community and Act II should be exceptional!

content:
Posted: January 23, 2014
												Estranged: Act I is a MOD for Half Life 2, it requires that you own any game which is built on the Source Engine.The game feels very much like a Half Life game, The Protagonist, a fisherman lost at sea, is a mute. You make landfall on a strange island and as you move through the island to find help, you meet people they help develop the story further. You find weapons with limited ammo, enemies and there are even occasional puzzles for you to solve before you can continue the journey.Voice acting throughout the game is excellent, the game builds immersion instantly and the soundtracks are 10/10. However, the enemies are of limited threat, and the character model for some of them looks like something from back in 2002.Although the game is relatively short (it took me 86 minutes to complete) I thoroughly enjoyed it. It is evident that this is only Act I and there are more Acts to come!4/5 – Great Experience.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 28, 2014
												An enjoyable well designed suspenseful adventure that plays like Half-Life (as you can imagine).  Though its over quite quickly the game length was actually longer than I expected.  Its does an admirable job to keep you going forwards, using loneliness to generate trepidation and build anticipaction despite its solely linear areas.  Even though gameworld interaction, puzzle solving and narration is limited, there is enough variety in the visuals combine well with the few action set-pieces to create an entertaining experience which is augmented by the very stylish use of music scores at key moments in gameplay.  Currently the game is free to play but consists of the first act, totally three chapters.  There are plans for three acts and a total of nine chapters.  My view is that now is the time to try it out cause and see if you like what you see.  I definitely did and  even though the game isnt designed to be replayable with any surprises, the achievements will likely mean you playthrough at least twice. A thumbs up from me for a HL sourced mod-based game.  Good effort.

content:
Posted: January 18, 2014
												Graphics: The Source engine is very limited to graphics. Estranged has really great graphics. There's Depth of Field, HBAO, film grain (I think this is already part of Source SDK 2013) and more. DoF and HBAO are really laggy if you're on an old PC (like mine :( ) so I recommend turning them off. Those two options are also Nvidia only, so if you want supah realistic graffix, get an Nvidia card. ATI/AMD (or whatever) cards are pretty behind in technology tbh. The game will still look good without HBAO and DoF on.Gameplay: The gameplay is pretty fun. There's zombies running at you trying to kill you. You can close yourself in a room so they can't reach you, or just kill them. The weapon variety is really small, there's only three weapons to choose from, and you can only carry one weapon. A pistol, an SMG, and a hammer. The pistol is pretty powerful, it can kill a zombie in 1 hit (headshot) and in 2 hits (body shots). The SMG is pretty weak, but it's fully automatic. The hammer is probably the worst weapon in the game (seriously xD) It's a melee weapon (obviously) and it can kill zombies in like 3 hits, but they can hit you first if you aren't careful. The weapons use the default HL2 animations, so that sucks. The pistol sounds like it's air, the SMG's model remains unchanged, and the hammer is a hammer. Nothing to it :D. There's also humans trying to kill you, and they can kill you pretty fast, so be careful. The game is pretty short, it's only like 2 hours long or so. Ever since the beta mod, they extended the ending a little bit and made it make more sense. There's also 9 achievements, and some of them can be annoying since they force you to go through the whole game again @_@Since i'm really bad at reviewing games, I only made 2 categories because I suck xDAnd the final verdict is: 9/10EDIT: Got a new graphics card and I can play with DoF and HBAO on, can't wait for Act 2 :D

content:
Posted: January 16, 2014
												Estranged: Act IA free first person adventure game powered by the HalfLife 2 Engine. Correction, a Free First person Survival Horror game. The reason I corrected myself is, before I downloaded Estranged, I was under the impression it was going be one of those first person interactive stories. Well, I was wrong. Basic story is, you receive a distress call on your boat. Something about they" have taken over the island. NExt thing you know you are floating in the water looking at your boat on fire right next to shore. From then you travel inland learning the jump, sprint, push, throw and other commands. The story progresses as you met a man who seemingly just murdered three people. He gives you his gun and away you go again. The atmosphere is eery and the sound a little jumpy. I unlocked my first achievement (yes this has achievements.. doesn't everything now?) when I found the lightswitch for a lamp in one of the cabins I came across. A moment later is where I came across my first Zombie. Equipped with glowing eyes and running full speed at me.This game requires a little bit of thinking to get past each area. There is a barrier and you have to examine the scene and determine what is missing. Once you figure it, usually by interacting with the environment or placing an object in a certain place or pattern you can move on.  I eventually got stuck. About eight Zombies at once attacked me. I killed all but one when I ran out of ammo. I was able to evade him but couldn't find out where to go so eventually gave up.The AI isn't too bright. One of the Zombies ran straight into a train and died. It wasn't as cool as it sounds though. The train wasn't moving.The game is free so I do recommend giving it a try just don't have high expectations.

Posted: April 2, 2014
												How to describe this Source Mod of Half Life 2...Well first, it's quite a unique game, one that you don't see too often anymore. Purely atmospheric, with some very appealing lighting and graphics. There is little to no music in the game, leaving you walking through a quiet and somewhat eerie area. Even so, this sets a perfect atmosphere, calmly, yet it still keeps you on your nerves.Admittedly, the story is somewhat cliché, but is still portrayed quite well. As you progress through new areas, you meet a few new people who give you small tasks that help you towards getting off of the stranded island you are on, with an unknown company blocking any outer communication. These characters are not always friendly, some attempting to kill you, just trying to survive in this perilous land. The voice actors are brilliant, bringing life to the game and to the characters they play.The graphics in this game are, while not perfect and somewhat buggy, still quite beautiful. There were multiple occasions where I would sit there for a few minutes and gaze out into the virtual horizon, taking in the quiet beauty. The lighting used in the maps are just worthy of a comment in itself. Dark areas have a dark glow to them, while the happier, lighter areas have a nice bright tinge to them. The infected are somewhat bland, looking as though they came from Star Trek and just have glowing yellow eyes, but they don't pose a threat, they are more there to remind you of the reason that you are there.As a total game, I found this to be quite impressive. I HIGHLY recommend this game to those with a passion for atmosphere. Considering this was made with the HL2 engine and is only the first Act of many to come, I can only wait in anticipation for the next few Acts. This game has impressed me quite a lot, with it unique atmosphere and dramatic music. As a total, this game brings back what was missing in the gaming community; Atmosphere. Modern games incorperate as much action as they can, sometimes not letting you take a break and take it all in, but this game let's you play and take it in at the same time. Very impressed with this game, can't wait for the next Acts.

												Really good level design. Really really reminiscent of Half Life 2 in term of level design (environment / puzzles) and global pacing / storytelling. The only things that prevent me from actually saying it's a good mod is the fact that it lacks something. Polishing in terms of animations, perhaps a bit more story polishing would have been better (such as reactions of the NPCs to the player, story wise (I'm thinking about the first meeting)), and a bit less of action was needed. The thing is you really feel all powerful, so the foes don't scare you as much as they should, in my opinion! Waiting for the Act2, and hoping the devs see my review and think about that. Estranged, is actually a HL² worship mod that could turn into much, much more.

Posted: January 19, 2014
												An odd one to say the least. A mod with an attention to detail that matches any "real" game. It's a fairly bland story, but the level design is simply superb. Even rivaling the game this is a mod of. It looks beautiful, which is odd as it is a mod of Half-Life 2 which even with the updated texture packs still shows its age. This mod on the other hand gives a fairly large overhaul (enough to distract me from the thought that it is a mod) and a nice lighting feel that really left me empressed.However the biggest downfall of this mod is the ending is very displeasing. I can't crituiqe more with out spoiling it, and I presume that the suprise of it was the design desision behind it, but even still it was a fairly lack luster ending even for a mod. That being said however I am a man who believes the journey is what is important not the destinaton. In which case this mod is a must play for anyone who owns Half Life 2. You will not regret it, feeling emotions from fear, despair, suspision and relief. All pulled off amazingly.In conclusion, play this mod. 9/10 would play again.

Posted: January 17, 2014
												When I first heard of this game coming out, I was extremely excited. I knew there would be mystery, puzzles and was very eager to download this free game. I got even more excited (Spoiler Alert)  when I learned it was about an island overrun by zombies. Yes, i do love my zombies. Here are my thoughts on this game:The story, I dare say is a teensie bit cliche. It is formatted like some other ones that i have heard and played. The beggining had me very intrigued, and I was excited to continue playing to better understand this mysterious story.Yet, as I went on, it was the same old thing. It was more puzzle and walking down hallways (Spoiler Alert) than shooting zombies in the damn face. There were only about two real gun scenes. Yes, I like exploration but if your not going to put much in it than at LEAST substitute it with shooting things. It wasent even real puzzles, it was lift this crate put it here take this thing throw it over there. I even found the (Spoiler Alert) easter egg of that tv watching zombie without even trying.So, why you may ask, am I reccomending it? Because it is free, and not only that but i think the developers can turn it around. This is act one of maybe many acts and im hoping very, very much that the developers can improve on this idea. Cliche, yes, but fun and it did have some jump scares. With that said I wish the developers best of luck and i will continue to download (maybe buy if you put a price on it) each act of this game.

Posted: March 2, 2014
												If you are looking for a horror game that doesn't always use the typical methods, (predictable jump scares, loud music, hordes of creatures) is a decnt length for an episodic game, has a very interesting and enthralling story and has made great use of the tools it was given in the Half Life 2 engine then Estranged Act I is something you should definately try out. As a free to play, you have nothing to lose.GAMEPLAYAs I said the game uses the Half Life 2 engine so nothing has really changed from movement, interaction or combat. There are a couple nice additions though such as interactable computers and the fact you are only allowed to carry one weapon at a time which gives it a nice realistic and survivalist feel. While not having a lot of combat, the horror is mostly made up of what you expect to happen but doesn't. I was yellnig at the game in my mind, "God damnit, just do what you're gonna do and get it over with already!" It's a very effective way to enduce fear as I found myself searching round corners a lot more than I usually would, your torch runs on dying batteries so I only used it for a couple seconds if I had to and I was reluctant to go into dark area's without preparing myself first. (I resisted the urge to turn on my television for noise in the background while I played. :) )SOUNDA completely original soundtrack was used on this game and it stands out as a very eerie and unsettling score to represent how the character is feeling. There isn't really an ongoing ambient track and specific music only plays at certain parts.But when the music isn't playing youre usually in silence which is extremely daunting as every noise can set you off. With only the gentle breeze passing by me and the chirping of the early morning birds, I found myself jumping everytime I accidentaly knocked over something on more than one occasion. Either just because it was loud enough to make me jump or I was worried that it would attract the "Yellow eyes." The team behind it has also employed their own voice actors to add a lot of original dialogue to the game to make it feel like a true standalone game. There are no re-used material of any of the Half Life or Source games, it's all them and they do an amazing job of it.LOOKStunning graphics on an aging engine, they have made the game look miles better with their take on lighting. It's hard to explain exactly but the lighting makes the game feel so realistic. You walk under a streetlight and its bright all around you, but when you walk away it isn't just sudden;y darker, it gets darker gradually. That is the same with entering and exiting buildings, turning on lights or lights from computers and lamps etc.STORY (MINOR SPOLIERS!)The story is a very interesting one. You are a lone fisherman who's boat has just crashed onto a mysterious island which seems deserted... at first. Upon meeting a guy who lost his wife and daughter somewhere three months ago, you see him shoot a yellow eyed man in cold blood. When you set off on your own to find a way to exit the island you come across more of these monsters, strange communication arrays and an equally mysterious company known as Arque.(MINOR SPOILERS END)This is definately a game you do not want to miss. Hopefully soon they will bring out an Estranged Act II as there are many questions I need answers to. :)

Posted: January 22, 2014
												Going into Estranged: Act 1, I was expecting some kind of Dear Esther-ish experience - that feeling of exploration, perhaps with a few token puzzles.  I got the token puzzles, but definitely not any sense of exploration.The puzzles were as token as can be, if you've played Half-Life 2 onwards (which I assume you have if you're playing this mod) then you've solved all these puzzles before.  In Estranged we experienced, to name but a few "stop the giant fan from spinning!", "unplug/plug the electrical thingy!", "get to the other side of this electrified body of water by creating a bridge somehow!", "turn off the valve!", "stack the boxes!" and "brick through window".  I don't remember any real twists to the puzzles just carbon copies of what we've solved before in HL2 and many other mods.I don't really think "explore" is a word I would associate with this game, maybe "travel", you travel down the narrow corridors of levels, sometimes passing something and thinking "oh that looks cool" (like first seeing the hula doll's shadow, 5th screenshot on store page) but never never really exploring, looking for things, small details and even if you did you wouldn't find many.  Countless times I was enticed by a warm, glowing room expecting to find something of use, or at least something interesting unfortunately what I found 90% of the time was a room full of boxes or pallettes or barrels, don't bother looking behind them.  There's probably nothing there.After the first character you meet the voice acting is very good (sorry first guy!), in fact sound is something that the game gets right, the soundtrack is very fitting to the game's atmosphere and never feels out of place (available  here [anicator.bandcamp.com]).I'm sure you've seen the word "atmospheric" mentioned in all of these reviews, and they're right, it is atmospheric.  The lighting was the main thing that I felt made it so.  From the shadow of a zombie on the wall keeping you on your toes to the cold, blue flourescent tubes of the treatment plant gently but clinically reminding you of where you are.  Not as atmospheric as playing Dear Esther in a cave on the Outer Hebrides whilst a posh man reads random pages of letters and diary entries into your ear, but, you know, good enough.Anyway, I'm done rambling, basically don't go into this expecting anything different or original, it's all been done before.  What Estranged is, is a solidly made FREE mod that takes up an hour of your time, why not just give it a try?  If you don't enjoy it you haven't exactly invested much and if you do, I assume that there's more on the way!

Posted: January 19, 2014
												An odd one to say the least. A mod with an attention to detail that matches any "real" game. It's a fairly bland story, but the level design is simply superb. Even rivaling the game this is a mod of. It looks beautiful, which is odd as it is a mod of Half-Life 2 which even with the updated texture packs still shows its age. This mod on the other hand gives a fairly large overhaul (enough to distract me from the thought that it is a mod) and a nice lighting feel that really left me empressed.However the biggest downfall of this mod is the ending is very displeasing. I can't crituiqe more with out spoiling it, and I presume that the suprise of it was the design desision behind it, but even still it was a fairly lack luster ending even for a mod. That being said however I am a man who believes the journey is what is important not the destinaton. In which case this mod is a must play for anyone who owns Half Life 2. You will not regret it, feeling emotions from fear, despair, suspision and relief. All pulled off amazingly.In conclusion, play this mod. 9/10 would play again.

Posted: January 23, 2014
												Estranged : Act I is a really great cinematographic-like experience with wonderfull visuals and a nice sound atmosphere. I wrote "can" because as it still in development you'll able to play only to the act one. So we've to be patient and greelight this stuff as we liked it.Of course, it's not perfect  :It's about 1hour of gameplay, it's kind of short. I can also regret the choice made for the equipment, i'd love to have more than one weapon on myself on this island. For the enemies we only had four/five models of "infected" and the AI have to be more worked.But i can easily forget what i wrote before because this graphic render is really really HUGE. Textures are beautifull and the ambiant occlusion work very well. I think that some details miss, but as it's the source engine i'm impressed. The artistic direction is very cool too, especially the music direction, perfect fit with the screen and well produced.So, if you are an HL player or a mystery movie fan, you should try this, you'll not be disappointed !

												In my opinion Estranged is really good and worth trying, why?Let's take a look at the gameplay at first, there are similaritys to the Half Life series (which I think is the best singleplayer fps) like the puzzle parts, the level design and the enemies (how often they appear and so on). Now let's take a look at the atmosphere which is created like in Half Life by barely telling a story and giving informations in very little pieces you have to find. The graphics are quite good, not like Battlefield 4 or Crysis 3 but considdering the hardware requirements it's the best you can get I think. Last but not least this game shows the Source Engine is still able to provide really good gameplay an graphics.To put it in a nutshell this Game/Mod really shows potetial and I can't wait for the next part.Ps: I didn't mention the story because I think it's to early to talk about, but let me say I have quite a good feeling about it.

Posted: January 17, 2014
												Really good level design. Really really reminiscent of Half Life 2 in term of level design (environment / puzzles) and global pacing / storytelling. The only things that prevent me from actually saying it's a good mod is the fact that it lacks something. Polishing in terms of animations, perhaps a bit more story polishing would have been better (such as reactions of the NPCs to the player, story wise (I'm thinking about the first meeting)), and a bit less of action was needed. The thing is you really feel all powerful, so the foes don't scare you as much as they should, in my opinion! Waiting for the Act2, and hoping the devs see my review and think about that. Estranged, is actually a HL² worship mod that could turn into much, much more.

Posted: January 26, 2014
												Enstranged is a fantastic mod, and I highly recommend it to anyone into adventure games.The atmosphere is constantly changing, but never fails to interest you, creep you out, or get you pumped for the next encounter.The voice acting is great, and could hardly be improved whatsoever.The difficulty is challenging, but the enemies do not overcrowd you. This makes for a less action-filled game, but reduces the need to be shooting 24/7 and in my opinion, suits the style of the game very well.The graphics are just like HL2, only with some fancier effects. These are really appealing.The physics are great, as in any source-based game.Overall, I'd say the game is worthy of a 9/10, with it's main flaw being that it is a short game!At the extremely low price of $0.00 and a small download size, I'd argue that there's no excuse not to give this mod a try.

Posted: January 17, 2014
												When I first heard of this game coming out, I was extremely excited. I knew there would be mystery, puzzles and was very eager to download this free game. I got even more excited (Spoiler Alert)  when I learned it was about an island overrun by zombies. Yes, i do love my zombies. Here are my thoughts on this game:The story, I dare say is a teensie bit cliche. It is formatted like some other ones that i have heard and played. The beggining had me very intrigued, and I was excited to continue playing to better understand this mysterious story.Yet, as I went on, it was the same old thing. It was more puzzle and walking down hallways (Spoiler Alert) than shooting zombies in the damn face. There were only about two real gun scenes. Yes, I like exploration but if your not going to put much in it than at LEAST substitute it with shooting things. It wasent even real puzzles, it was lift this crate put it here take this thing throw it over there. I even found the (Spoiler Alert) easter egg of that tv watching zombie without even trying.So, why you may ask, am I reccomending it? Because it is free, and not only that but i think the developers can turn it around. This is act one of maybe many acts and im hoping very, very much that the developers can improve on this idea. Cliche, yes, but fun and it did have some jump scares. With that said I wish the developers best of luck and i will continue to download (maybe buy if you put a price on it) each act of this game.

Posted: January 25, 2014
												When I first went into this mod, I wasn't sure what to expect. I should have expected a great adventure...Estranged Act 1 is one of the finest HF2 mods I've played in a whileThe setting felt real; obviously one of the mods high points is it's atmosphereEverything on the map had a purpose, whether it be lighting, scenery, or something trying to kill you...The music and general audio authoring is top-notch, adding emphasis or background depending on what was happening...In some of the previous mods I've played, the voice acting lacked out of sheer inexperienceEstranged had voice acting that seemed to be coming right out of the NPC...Finally, the storyline had it's unexpected turn of events - a couple of them were predictable, but still had me at the edge of my seat...Now even though this game is a phenomenal achievement of their development team, it is not without its bugs.There were some parts where the video was a bit choppy. The other thing I noticed is that when you had the "Highlight important items" option on, you could sometimes see the items through cabinet or locker doors.Putting those two things aside, this HF2 mod kept me wanting more, and will definitely be anticipating Act 2My Rating: 8.5/10

Posted: March 15, 2014
												You can play this game for free, and it will only take two or three hours of your time.In many ways, it feels like a love letter to Valve games, but does enough original things to have its own identity. The design of the environments and atmosphere will leave you constantly looking out for something and checking behind you. The artificial scarcity of health and ammo plays into this as well. There is no difficulty selection as far as I could see, but the more resources you end up needing, the more you will find along the way. It keeps the flow of the gameplay going smoothly without making the player feel like there's too much going in their favor for there to be any real danger, which is something I think this mod does better than Half-Life 2, which threw health and ammo at you like confetti. Only give this game a pass for now if you're allergic to cliffhangers, because this mod does end rather abruptly, with absolutely no clues as to where it could go from here. Act II is only in development right now, but what's in Act I is solid and worth checking out.

Posted: January 17, 2014
												When I first heard of this game coming out, I was extremely excited. I knew there would be mystery, puzzles and was very eager to download this free game. I got even more excited (Spoiler Alert)  when I learned it was about an island overrun by zombies. Yes, i do love my zombies. Here are my thoughts on this game:The story, I dare say is a teensie bit cliche. It is formatted like some other ones that i have heard and played. The beggining had me very intrigued, and I was excited to continue playing to better understand this mysterious story.Yet, as I went on, it was the same old thing. It was more puzzle and walking down hallways (Spoiler Alert) than shooting zombies in the damn face. There were only about two real gun scenes. Yes, I like exploration but if your not going to put much in it than at LEAST substitute it with shooting things. It wasent even real puzzles, it was lift this crate put it here take this thing throw it over there. I even found the (Spoiler Alert) easter egg of that tv watching zombie without even trying.So, why you may ask, am I reccomending it? Because it is free, and not only that but i think the developers can turn it around. This is act one of maybe many acts and im hoping very, very much that the developers can improve on this idea. Cliche, yes, but fun and it did have some jump scares. With that said I wish the developers best of luck and i will continue to download (maybe buy if you put a price on it) each act of this game.

Posted: January 25, 2014
												Estranged is a great Source mod and shows that even in 2014, Source is alive and kicking. While the graphics may not be next-gen, the atmosphere is perfect. Estranged follows the journey of a fisherman who is marooned on an island infested with zombies (?), presumably left over after a science experiment gone wrong. While the story may be a little cliche, the gameplay is smooth and entertaining. Lighting and sound are used to great effect in this mod. The story is short (around 2 hours), but it's engaging and doesn't feel like a chore to finish. Eager to see what happens in Act 2.

Posted: January 17, 2014
												After following the mod for a long time, I expected a TON from this, sadly it didn't deliver, don't get me wrong, it's really well made, has great voice acting and is heavily inspired by Half Life 2, but unfortunately that's where it begins to suffer. The story has premise and potential, but the general lack of inspiration, ambient music and just atmosphere makes the game feel like a lackluster HL2 mod, this isn't helped by the stock HL2 animations, textures, sounds and even entire weapon models. For the most part this follows the basic HL2 structure, fight>puzzle>fight>story etc.  Throw in mediocre combat, easy puzzles and a slow moving plot, you find yourself bored for most of the experience. But this is a step in the right direction for the developer, the mod is VERY well made, the map design is excellent and shines quality, I feel it's simply the lack of polish that hurts the experience more than anything, throw in some nice models, nice animations and some more ambience, you will have an excellent game on your hands, for a "MOD" this is a fairly good experience, but for a "GAME" I feel it falls short on too many levels, As a full paid game, I wouldn't recommend this, but as a FREE mod? Yeah, try it, your experience may differ to mine.

Posted: February 2, 2014
												Estranged doesn't really feel like a Half-Life 2 mod. It feels like its own standalone game. If you own Half-Life 2, definitely download this. It is free. It is worth your time.If you don't have Half-Life 2, what the hell are you doing with your life? GO GET IT.Anyway, this is a great game. No, I am calling it a game. Technically, yes it is a mod, but it's also not. It almost completely converts the original Half-Life 2. The only noticable traces are one weapon model and a few recycled character models. The atmosphere is very, very nice and the improvement on the Source engine's graphics help add to the feel the developers were attempting to create.There aren't many complaints I have for this game. Sometimes it's a bit difficult to tell what you're supposed to do. Like at the end, I couldn't find the exit (although that may just be my blondeness) for about ten minutes. And there was this other part near the beginning of the game where there was a dark room with a train, I had to google what to do on that part.Other than that, I did really enjoy it. Fun to play, great experience, must download.I would give the developer(s) money for this. Well, I wouldn't because I'm on a budget. But if I had the money and I knew what this was, then I would pay for it if I had to, yes.

Posted: January 26, 2014
												This game, in my opinion, is a definite 5/5 stars.The atmosphere of the game in general was very eerie, which I absolutely love in horror games. Even as it progressed, it seemed to become more of an adventure game than a horror game. But as I played, I never forgot that I was on a near-deserted island filled with zombies and other hostilities that seem to scare me.The game takes you through a few terrains and such things as that, that never leave the game map in a boring way to think about it. I absolutely loved traveling the island and seeing the sights.I loved the way they scripted the weapons and physics. So you had to use logic when breaking glass, or the damage being realistic. It brought a challenge to me as I played. It kept me wanting to beat it, and I never lost focus.I think the only problem I noticed in the game was minor. When the zombies died, their arms kinda morphed into the rest of the body. But that's about all.I absolutely love this game, and I look forward to playing it again.I don't care how much the sequel costs...I don't care how much the download size is...I don't care how long it takes for it to be realeased...I WILL PLAY IT.

Posted: January 21, 2014
												Firstly,I can't belive how good this game is and secondly,that It's free! I got 40 minutes in and then had to go to work. Trust me,If I didn't have to stop playing it,I wouldn't have. I haven't played a game in ages that has captivated me quite like Estranged did,and have just been waiting for one to come along. It's left me feeling like I just have to leave a review for it.Upon having a look at it and at the beginning of first playing it,I thought I had a pretty good idea of what It was going to be like and what to expect,but I was completely wrong! You never really know where you're about to go/what's about to happen next,and with so many different types of locations and environments (on the coast,in a railway yard/line,warehouses,sewers,office buildings etc.) It keeps the game fresh and interesting. At one point I thought I was in Mirrors Edge haha,those who have played it will get what I mean. It feeds strongly on the emotion of curiosity leaving you wanting more!  The graphics start off very typical of a HL mod,but slowly get more and more beautiful throughout the game with the final result being absolutely brilliant. I felt as though this slow build up was done deliberately and is extremely noticeable as at first you may be a bit dissapointed,but hang in there! The majority of colours,textures and lighting are stunning and get better and better as the game progresses.Gameplay is HL typical,but awesome and familiar. It ranges from solving mini-puzzles of the surrounding objects to use of weapons like a hammer,pistol and machine gun to break things and take out enemies. You have control over some PC's (with a good bit of humour thrown in) and also a massive crane. Also,HL based games always make throwing stuff around so much fun!I could very easily rant on about this for ages,but It's really something you have try for yourself to completely understand how unique and good it is. The fact that It's free and a small download size leaves you with no excuses. I would easily have paid money for this,play it now!!!

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 13, 2016
												Free achievements have brought me to another interesting title.  A Half Life mod that brings suspicion and paranoia to your doorstep.For the squeemish, the "Horror" will lie in paranoia and zombies (bleach-skinned men with yellow eyes).  The environment is dark and creepy, but if you manage your pistol and hammer well, your fears will be short-lived.  Once you get the minigun and fight living humans, then the horror will be over.I would say this game had 3 arcs.  The forest arc, the sewers arc, and the lab-escape arc.  Just a few hours in and it's all over.PROS:+ Nice presentation+ Great use of suspense+ Ambient noises keep you on edge+ Easy achievements+ FreeCONS:- There are areas where you expect something to happen, only to find that it's a safe area and that your guard was up for no reason- Story feels negligible at best- Some physics may be faulty (Entering a vent with some garbage in the way can screw up the physics)- Lack of a sequel after at least 2 yearsOverall, despite the cold feeling of paranoia washing over me (along with being in a freezing room), I felt it was a pretty solid experience.  A short and easy 100% for achievement hunters.  My only complaint is that sometimes it feels empty when you don't really have anything to kill.  It's a shame to see a sequel hasn't been released yet, but with the story not feeling negligible, then I'm probably not missing much.8/10  A nice addition to Steam.

content:
Posted: January 16, 2014
												Estranged: Act 1 is a quite unique mod! Once you are pitted into the game with nothing but a destroyed boat, you are quick to know that you must survive. But against what, you ask. Against what is left of the entire island! Zombies, Rebels, and the means of finding ammunition and health! You must act smart, or die stupid. Featuring HBAO and DoF, this game puts the Source Engine at it's most powerful and provides you with an extremely HD quality experience with an awesome storyline and immersive gameplay. From start to end, you will be attached to the game, using your wits to survive the island, and learn its mystery! All for FREE! The game, "Estranged: Act I" is better than a lot of AAA titles out there! It is a professionally made mod! No laziness here! Explore the island, find supplies, evade zombie attacks, survive the survivors, solve the mystery. Become Estranged.

												Something short and sweet.I saw a lot of my friends play this, and I was like "What is Estranged?" They said "it's a game. A mod for HL2 or something."So I checked it out. I felt like the game was nice. The level design was pretty interesting at first, yet having it's boring bland to it, especially if you have a flashlight. I did have some trouble here and there with the game, but at certain parts I felt like there needed to be a little more design here and there. Hell, even if it's just the first act, I'll be waiting to play the next one. I also felt like the ammo was scarce in the beginning. Not that it matters, but still.Estranged: Act I really brought my attention to an adventure, soaring through a set of new levels. While the entire game is still in development, I would still love to see more of this.

content:
Posted: January 31, 2014
												Estranged is a shooter made in the source engine and was a Half Life mod but now that its fully realeased is it worth it to play through. In the game you play as a lone fisherman and one stormy night your boat crashes on a deserted island which you find out is filled by zombies. So its up to you to find a way off the island. Estranged is a shooter and if you played Half Life its pretty simmilar. The shooting mechanics work great its pretty fun and plus its Absolutly FREE. With this kinda deal you really cant go wrong. Its a fun game, great story and creepy atmosphere. Now there are some minor issues with this title. The biggest one is the stupid puzzles. The game has you finding items to complete puzzles. Some items are scattered through the enviroments and theyre so small its really easy to miss them.Overall a really fun shooting game with a great atmosphere and a great story and plus its free you cant go wrong. I give Estranged Act 1 a 7/10

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 7, 2014
												Estranged Act 1 is surprisingly good considering it is a comunity built game with no commercial backing, done for fun.If you are expecting a Tripple-A grade game, you probably should look elsewhere, but keep in mind this is completely free.The atmosphere is quite good, as are many of the elements of the level layout.  The world does feel tangable and coherant, and has a lot of small details that make it more immerisve.   Little drawings and readable notes and whiteboards all make things more interesting, and make it feel like you are going through a real workplace where something went horibly wrong.   It definately leaves me wanting to know more.As of the problems:The biggest issue has to be the NPC animations.  Many of them are simply non-existant.   The zombies more stumble around, rather than stagger, and there is very little in the way of animation.In some spots the difficulty feels artificially added through making the machine gun weaker, and artificially improving the abilities of the AI to land good hits.  This is particularly so when you are assaulted in the warehouse.  Generally the AI on these tactical units is quite good.The layout of many of the levels isn't the best.  There is an excessively liniar feel to them.  The zombie placement is a little predictable and their spawning sometimes comes from nowhere.  However, that is a very common problem in many games.As of the graphics, they aren't too bad, but they aren't particularly good either.   There are definately plenty of places they could be improved, such as the detail plants, and a few textures.  However, in other spots they look better than some comercial games on the same engine.   I have to say the rocky cliff side in one spot is downright exceptional.  The real disappointment is the lack of consistancy

number of helpful: 8 of 17 people (47%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 20, 2014
												I'm on the fence with this one.I'm putting "Do Not Recommend" only to highlight the fact that I didn't enjoy it, not that I recommend you stay away from it.  It's free, after all - it's not like you're paying money to try it, in which case, "Do Not Recommend" would probably keep you away.Take the gushy reviews with a grain of salt on this one.  I'm seriously hoping that the developers have something better up their sleeve for the next couple of parts.  A few things: for the most part, it is not scary.  Not once did the "zombies" frighten me at all - the only really chilling part of this game was the soundtrack (which was very well done).  The atmosphere is well done, and they did an incredibly good job with the lighting.  I liked the general gist of the story, except for the fact that it's yet another source-engine zombie mod.  Guys, you don't need zombies to make a game scary.  The original F.E.A.R creeped me out more than this game (or any other zombie game, for that matter), and for the most part, you were just fighting AI soldiers.  All you need is atmosphere, atmosphere, atmosphere: and with the amazing soundtrack in this game and the graphical capabilities, that can definitely be achieved. Speaking of graphics, here's where I found another issuse: a lot of inconsistency.  The lighting is fantastic, as are what appear to be custom textures, but they clash heavily with the HL-2 assets.  There's a custom pistol model, yet the SMG from HL-2.  The interior of the Arque facilities reminded me of Mirror's Edge (in a very good way), and in minutes, you were stepping back into 2004.  If you want to stick with HL-2 assets only, that's fine.  If you want to use custom assets, also fine.  But swapping back and forth between the two of them made me wince - as did the Kleiner and guard models.It's also linear as hell, but the levels are large, and designed well.  The voice acting is so well done, it makes me wonder why they have a silent protagonist.   In summary, go for it - it's free to play - but be wary.  Hell, if they started charging money for it on the condition that there would be all-custom models and textures, I would probably buy in.  But at this rate, Estranged isn't the best thing out there.+ Top-notch voice acting.+ Excellent soundtrack.+ Free to play.+ Large levels.+ A couple of neat interactive sequences.+ The story is going somewhere, but...+/- Squeezes even more life out of the old Source engine, for better or worse.+/- Linear, but it balances out with the size of the levels.+/- Combat is far too repetitive and easy.  These zombies truly are brain dead.  - Zombies.- Recycled HL-2 NPC models.- Inconsistency in the graphics.- It's a sin to use the word "puzzle" when referring to the "puzzles" in this game.  They're about as complex as a lunchbox.- ...it probably could've been executed better.  The first act doesn't set up the plot very strongly, so it's a crapshoot for the next act.

content:
Posted: January 16, 2014



YouTube™ Video:  

			Views: 0		



Estranged acts as a game experience rather than just a game. Which is something you don't find that often nowadays. It is limited by Half Life 2 engine but it still delivers a lot of beautiful scenarios. There's certainly points where I think there's room for improvement. The sound could be better: there's a lot of silence, it misses some constant environment sound; the voice acting could be better.But considering the small team that brought Estranged to life and considering it's free to play there's nothing more you could ask, it's a great piece of work you should pick and play yourself!I'll leave my Let's play here if you're interested, enjoy!

content:
Posted: April 28, 2014
												Estranged is a singleplayer mod for HL2 which is in short; quite amazing I say.The story is slightly confusing but I suppose you're not going to know everything about what's going on in the very first Act.I had a blast playing this. It has very, very fine atmosphere. The map design is incredible. I was on the edge of my seat a couple of times. But I would never call this close to a horror mod.The cons? Some will hate the 1-weapon-only option and lack of ammo/arsenal. But my biggest issue was the gunfight. I only found amusement in the very end. The rest of the game is way too easy to beat. I also think they should give a little more exploration possibilities for the next act as this one was a bit cramped at times.But in overall; Estranged is a mod that singleplayer lovers and HL2-enjoyers SHOULD try out. Disregard the negative feedbacks, they don't know what they're talking about.7.5/10

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 22, 2014
												Nice little game, not the best out there but still an okay 80-100 minutes game if you've nothing better to play. Also free.Combat is meh, you get the option to disable HUD (highly recommended for extra immersion) and the crosshair (pointless because you cant aim with the gun sights). Fighting zombies becomes repetitive once you killed 2 or 3, but there are better enemies further on.Level design is above par, 12/10, beautiful indoors environments, with great lightning and ambient sounds, beautiful water, if you like urban exploration this game has a big segment in which you can roam around a facility with varying levels of abandonment and no enemies, so it's just you wandering around some very well designed levels.Maps are not linear, there are siderooms and alternate paths in a lot of places that you might miss, so I guess that adds just a little replayabilityPuzzles are your typical HL2 puzzles, find a lever, put it in place and pull it and the such. It's not R&D.Story is meh, you're a boat guy and you crash on an island with a facility that let out some sort of zombie virus. The levels tell part of the story, which is nice, instead of it being 100% NPC exposition dialog.Overall a 6/10, which is good considering it's a free game you can download in a matter of minutes. Don't let the lame♥♥♥♥♥zombies in the begining put you off, it ends up being enjoyable past the first 15-20 minutes.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 18, 2014
												Well, this was a small surprise. This is an original game built on the Source engine and Half-Life 2 assets. It's free to play too.You're a sailor who is having an accident with his boat, crashing on the shores of an island. The place seems abandoned, and indeed, you quickly learn that not everything is as it should be. Something has gone wrong and you'll get to trek around the place to figure out what's going on, and trying to help the people you meet.What I first noticed was how good it looks, considering it's built on what seems to be an earlier version of Source. The second thing was the atmosphere, which I think they did a very good job with. The place really feels abandoned, and it's accompanied with well-timed, atmospheric music. It seems obvious that they found a lot of inspiration from games like Half-Life 2. While using several assets from that game, they have really managed to make it their own creation.The characters you meet have been given convincing voices. The game is also sprinkled with clues and memos, including newspapers, scribbles and interactive workstations. They managed to get a little humor in there too. The game is absolutely linear, but here and there are rooms and places you can explore, even though they rarely hold anything useful, just like in real life. At times the game seems a bit stretched out though. Some parts could've been skipped without hurting the story and experience.It took me about 2 hours to finish. After finishing the game I noticed I had some achievements left, so there's a little bit of replay value there. This is just act 1, so there's more content to come, but I know nothing about it. Apparently, Occulus Rift is supported for those that have that option.I don't see any reason not to try it out, considering it's free. I think it was surprisingly good.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 20, 2014
												I liked this game... but I had expected more than just pretty graphics. This game has not even scared me or made me paranoid of anything.... it's the zombie outbreak with the soldiers trying to kill you.... typical kind of thing that people would do. Also "Jack" in the beginning seemed like a character that I would like to hang with in the adventure,but instead they just say "Here take my only weapon I have I dont need to live anymore". Mostly this game feels like HL2 with the traveling places which bores me, and I don't get the thrill that other people get I guess.... Now as I continue on the combat mechanic is awful I dont feel any accuracy in my weapon also a nice aim down the sights would have been more nice than a zoom in feature... Also it's just like HL2 when it come to "GO IN THE DOOR BEFORE ME" mechanic which should be fixed. Now this game as I said it has lots of potential,and should reconsider their story line a bit of edit to make it seem more realistic than you wondering alone.... Cause I just want to know if they could possibly consider characters that have different models than the default HL2 dummies :p. Now I know this is a FREE 2 PLAY! game these are consideration's if they wanted to SELL the whole game. Also in this game I feel like im on an adventure than a escape mission from an island which I have to say I never feel like that in other games besides "The Legend of Zelda" series.

content:
Posted: March 21, 2014
												Its a free to play game.So far that only have act 1. So i assume there will be more to come if its not forgotten about and left to rot.It plays well, not really scary or suspencful, after you get the train. (It was pretty good up till you have to get off, and find out theres nothing to be scared of anymore with a gun, pocket full of ammo, and the 'zombies' can get caught up just trying to walk over a curb, starirs, or through a doorway.)It was good up till that point, but afterwards turns into another FPS shooter. No horror. No suspence. Just run and gun. I liked getting on the train, and i had hopped to be able to use it again or even often. Moving from place to place to fight off and survive the zombies while you get it moving again, then hop back on and escape the hoards.But it doesnt play out like that.The level design is pretty good. Though most people will be able to see where parts of it was cut from games like Mirrors edge, half life 2, and the other source engine games.Even then it manages to keep the level a little different, and change the puzzles and challenges up to be different from the game they copied it from.Do i recommend this game? Yes.Its not the best, and could do with some more work, but its free and makes for a good couple of hours to waste in something a little different.

content:
Posted: January 18, 2014
												The gameplay is what you would expect, it's a Half-Life 2 mod so it plays like Half-Life 2. The story line is decent, but it's more of an adventure and less about character developement. Estranged is split up into different acts (example game The Walking Dead) and each act has chapters that which you can choose from. The game truly never gets boring and has about 3 to 4 hours of gameplay depending on the weapons you choose and whether you take your time or speed through it. It's a fairly easy game and you can't beat the price of free. It's worth the try, and if you don't like it, oh well. You didn't spend any money on it. If you liked it then good, you'll be excited for Act 2.

content:
Posted: February 2, 2014
												A first person mix of horror elements, light half-life based environmental puzzles and functional (albeit cliche'd) story. You play as a stranded fisherman on an island where some "secret experiments" by a corporation has gone wrong and now there are zombies walking all over the island. Later on, you'll meet the company's cleaning crew who want to get rid of you, permanantly.Since the game is made with the Source engine it looks great and plays great too. It's a little short (maybe 1 hour experience) but it's free and this is only Act I of the whole story. Try this out it's a pretty entertaining ride while it lasts.
