content:
Posted: January 25, 2014
												First piece of a cake, I suppose?Quite a good beginning, the start felt like a good start for a real adventure! I liked the fact players had to think of ways how to progress to the next part instead of just opening the doors and such, unfortunately from there it felt a bit cliche at times - I couldn't help it but sometimes I felt like I am playing several different games I have played before mixed into one game - familiar environments, familiar characters, weapons and last but not least, lately a bit overused zombie genre - don't get me wrong, I am a fan of zombie stuff, I just wish to see something with deeper story than just another zombie shooting gallery, but overall I didn't feel bored playing through this Act I, I just honestly hope the overall experience will improve later - this game feels like a mixture of an adventure and a classic first person shooter, which isn't a bad idea at all when it's done well.So at this point, if I may suggest something for developers, I think it would be a good idea to focus more on an adventure part of the game and put the players deeper into the story. Make the danger higher to actually make the players realize that there actually is some danger they should be afraid of. Maybe even give the players some hazardous tasks, like to protect survivors so that they will feel more tense since it's not just their lives they need to take care of but also give the players some creative ways how to avoid or take out the enemies instead of just shooting them or smashing their heads with hammer, because too much of shooting or smashing heads with hammer can make the game feel repetitive at times and more ways how to get rid of enemies will give the players better adventure experience, also more puzzles and harder puzzles wouldn't hurt.Overall, I think this game has a good potential and so far it's done well, especially for a mod, so like I said, it's a nice start but the whole experience will depend on what is coming next and I am looking forward to play more of this game, long hours of gameplay with a deep story would be nice!

content:
Posted: February 9, 2015
												Wonderfully crafted source engine game.The only two gripes I have are only being able to carry one weapon - I suggest they up it to two. And in a couple of areas the level design was a little amateurish - there's only so much the source engine can do, and outside areas in particular are hard to close in well without breaking off immersion, but there's a good bit of room for improvement.Now despite what I just said, the level design throughout the rest of the game was fantastic. The office areas in particular were wonderfully atmospheric. The pacing is also well done, a few action moments here and there with plenty of long breaks to build the tension up again.Combat is standard fair for a source engine game, but it doesn't take away anything from the game. In the beginning especially I was particularly ammo starved - sometimes running from enemies is the best way to go about. As far as the story - it's cliche, at least based on what we're given so far, but it's well done cliche.At the low, low price of nothing, this game is definitely worth checking out.

content:
Posted: July 16, 2014
												Really awesome mod.I find the voice acting really great and the gameplay smooth.I play most of single player games on hard because I like challenging games but the restrictions of 1 weapon is a bit harsh in my humble opinion.I do understand that you don't want the player to wear all weapons like Freeman does with his suit, but if you ask me to wear a hand gun and an smg, I could put my hand gun in my pocket and the smg in my hands and vice versa.Maybe try to design some more customized weapons with different magazine capacity, scopes, etc...Maybe some new npc design because I find out that using Kleiner as the NPC has quite suprised me to be honest.I was looking foward to seeing new faces, new weapon types, etc... but guess it's not going to be, yet.I've been following the development of this game/mod since the beginning & I love the level design, well done on it (yeah, I'm a level designer for Source, if you're interested).The new entities incorporated (especially the lighting entities) made the game seem more realistic, and loved the lighting too.While the game looks really great, some improvements can be implemented.I'm looking forward to playing Act II & Act III.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 22, 2014
												One of the best HL2 single player mods. Though, it is not perfect. I really liked the atmosphere and the mystery at the beginning of the game, and some of the puzzles, even if they don't really need so much brain to solve - until you get the machine gun. The pistol had a unique design, and you barely found ammo, so it was still scary and difficult at moments, to deal with enemies, but the submachine gun is the same as in HL2, so it was kinda out of place in this game, and it killed the difficulty too. Plus, there are very few enemies to have a submachine gun, and also, the dark is not so scary anymore, if you got an automated killermachine in your hands... The ending was really unexpected, and cliffhanger, so looking forward to the next act.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 17, 2014
												At first, I figured this would be your run of the mill horrorcore disasterpiece - I actually was mistaken. The story-line (and mind you, I'm not really all that far into the game) seems very interesting. Feeling a little like No More Room In Hell, I was ready to be bored within minutes, but the over-all feel of the game is so much better.  I never did like how fast batteries run out in games and this one is exactly the same with that - find a battery and you have a very limited amount of time to get around and see in the dark.The sound effects are probably my favorite part - besides the background - each thing you hit with a hammer or throw something at, it really sounds realistic.  Very well done.I'm excited to continue and would love to see this game come in a bundle - free or not, I'd definitely recommend it to anyone interested in some solo-horror style games.

												What starts off as a really awesome spooky-atmospheric exploratory survival game quickly turns into HL-esque corridor shooter and puzzle solver with typical "jumping on random sewer pipes, pressing random buttons, because PROGRESS." I kind wish it stayed the former.That being said, it's really well crafted and polished for a mod with some really interesting set-pieces (like train crossing or the chair bit), so recommended for fans of Half Life or the like.

number of helpful: 40 of 82 people (49%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 17, 2014
												It's free, but it's really short, the pacing is weird, and it feels like the game didn't know what it wanted to be.  There's no bravado when it comes to presentation in this game.  I'm not saying the game should be a Michael Bay movie, but there's no buildup to ANYTHING.  The first zombie you see is just inside of a bush, and he comes out screaming at you.  No tension building, just "BLEH, a zombie!"  The mod has a very strange idea of what pace it wants to take, though.  There are sometimes long stretches of time where nothing interesting happens at all.  No interesting set pieces, no fights, nothing.  Then at the end, everything that could be considered interesting is thrown at you, all at once!There's also a very strange lack of exploration in this mod.  For something labelled as "adventure," it sure didn't want me to explore.  Virtually every door I tried, except for the one to lead me further into the level, was locked.  The mod is too linear for its own good.I suppose you should still try it, because it IS free, and it does have some interesting and really pretty environments.  As long as they listen to feedback and improve episode 2, it could be a really good mod.

number of helpful: 10 of 22 people (45%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 19, 2014
												I was literally charmed by the landscapes - never thought source engine could do that. Unfortunately that's all I feel being charmed about. The story is a mediocre attempt to build some tension around nothing. It just goes like corridors, corridors, jump here, press there...OH A ZOMBIE...corridors etc. The puzzles are so simple you may not even notice them. Yes guys, to break a window with a brick IS considered to be a puzzle in this game. The enemies are ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ and I also wonder why no one has even tried to script any scary zombie encounter into the game. Like come on, if they're that stupid at least try to make them appear in a scary manner. But no - they mostly just sit peacefully until you come too close.5/10 for the beautiful nature. Hopefully it will get better in ACT 2.

number of helpful: 7 of 16 people (44%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 19, 2014
												Estranged may have been an exciting and interesting foray into a video game world a few years ago, but its archaeic puzzle designs and simplistic gameplay beg the question "What is this doing in this generation?" A Half-Life 2 Mod, Estranged tells the story of Fenwick the Fisherman on his journey through a spooky island community populated by ghouls and other nasties. Along the way you must solve physics puzzles including fan favorites such as the "Put A Crate on Another Crate" and "Throw A Rock At The Breakable Thing". The story and environment, while interesting, are nothing to holler about and the game itself is simple in both combat and puzzles. Many of the game's conundrums are over before they begin and the entire mod feels like someone spent an afternoon with the HL2 creation kit. That being said, the mod itself has great musical quality and the level design looks quite nice even in the post-Source age. Do these qualities save the mod, however? Unfortunately not. Even being free, the designers will have to think of some new tricks for Episodes 2 and 3, because if you've played Half-Life 2, you've already seen this mod.

Posted: June 1, 2014
												This game is beautiful. I love the graphics and the sound, it has one of the best plots I have seen in awhile. A lone fisherman on an island where something that only comes out of fiction or a horror movie occurs. And when you first get the gun, you feel powerful, until you realize you have very limited ammo. This game can get terrifying when you are attacked from behind with out warning, that's what makes it so tense. Get this game, it's free. I HIGHLY recommend it.

content:
Posted: January 18
												Estranged: Act 1 took me only about an hour and a half to complete (and I could have halved that time if I was complete s***), yet after the gameplay and (minor) exploration, and the cliffhanger-iest cliffhanger to ever hang, I find myself very excited to play the secondinstallment. Being a Half-Life mod, it plays very similarly, as you'd expect, and simply swaps the aliens with zombies and the soldiers with slightly different soldiers, the story is intriging. It seems obvious that the shady corporation with its logo plastered on every billboard, bus stop, and behind, is behind everything but I would hope the story doesn't go down that road as it seems a little cheap, and I feel a spawn of Half-Life shoudl be above that. I would also like to give the game points on using the zombies before the soldiers, since they don't shoot back, which creates a simple difficulty curve for the player. Now I'm off to Estrage: Act II, which had better not make me regret giving this one leway in the story department.

content:
Posted: October 5, 2014
												I love this game! it has a Original Gameplay and Story - The game features around an hour of story driven gameplay. It includes a completely original cast, with a carefully crafted script to bring the Estranged world to life. Amazing Graphics - Estranged is built on the same engine Half-Life 2 runs, with some additional features. We have extended the dynamic lighting system to allow us to illuminate our levels in a realistic manner, and have included effects such as film grain and lens flare to help create the atmosphere for the game. Original Soundtrack - The soundtrack was written especially for Estranged, and was designed alongside the game's levels. The music matches gameplay, and helps to bring together the atmosphere in Estranged to bring the story to life. O:

number of helpful: 13 of 29 people (45%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 3, 2015
												Estranged: Act I is a horror FPS that starts out strong and then peters out into mediocrity, a testament to its shortness.For starters, the game looks decent. There's a mix of Half-Life 2 assets and custom assets, but it's consistent enough to work well. The custom graphical effects and use of dynamic lighting are also very well-done, even if the depth of field is a little strong. The levels are well-constructed from a visual standpoint, the music is fitting, and the game doesn't rely on jumpscares to pull the fear out of you.That said, the game's mechanics are so recognizable that the horror element won't last longer than, say, 45 minutes. The zombies you fight never really felt challenging. The scare was more "me not knowing what they're capable of," and it gets easy to see what they're capable of. Also, the game sometimes puts them in cheap places. I feel like enemies this simple could be much scarier if used in different ways.In addition, you also fight a few non-zombie combatants. Their AI is good, but the main danger comes from the fact that they can kill you in a few shots. Unlike Half-Life 2, you have to be careful and take cover constantly. It's a decent amount of fun, but there are really only two spots where the game plays with this concept. There's also a mandatory "crane" section, because that was *totally* fun in Half-Life 2.The crane bit brings me to one of my biggest complaints about Estranged: Act I: the level design I said before that the levels were well-constructed from a visual standpoint, but from a game standpoint, they're bad. The game uses the Valve trick of light and darkness to tell you where to go or what to do, but none of it makes sense in the game's world. Just random spotlights that have no reason to be there. The levels are straightforward and most of the time are just corridors with nothing happening. No chance for implied stories or combat or navigation. The levels aren't compact, practical, or even useful, in some cases. It feels so disjointed. I felt like there was never a reason for most of this environment to exist, and it killed the immersion for me. I haven't seen level design this impractical since the original Half-Life.Then there's the issue of length. The game is VERY short. It's free, yes, but that's no excuse for breaking it up into tiny segments like this. There's no story development, none of the characters are even remotely interesting, the player character is even more of a blank slate than types like Gordon Freeman and Link, and the pacing is nonexistent. I don't care if this is an episodic game, you still have to take me somewhere that isn't another shooting gallery. Telltale and Valve have both proven that it's possible to make episodic games with pacing just as good as their full-length big brothers. When the game ends, it just kind of...ends. There's no climax or falling action. It's just "Welp, you're done! See you later!"I wouldn't be so upset with this if it weren't for the fact that this game shows potential. It looks and controls great, and I was genuinely scared in the beginning as I crept forward, anxiouslyt waiting for something to pop out that never came. It's just that the game lets its guard down so quickly and devolves into the same routine. It's too recognizable, the level design is unrealistic, and it's over before you know it. Hopefully Act II can fix these mistakes. I would be surprised if it did.

content:
Posted: May 30, 2014
												I thought this game held many promises. An interesting plot of how you wake up on a mysterious island after your fishing boat crashed. It told of how you would unwravel the mystery about the mysterious island you are traversing (Which is quite linear, but I don't mind.), and how it said that you would interact with many colorful character. Everything I expected and what I read was a lie. Estranged: Act One is a failed attempt at a stealth/suspense zombie survival game. You rarely come across characters, and when you get the pistol in the beginning, there is not enough ammo whatsoever to keep yourself alive, as you wold need to run. I did think that the game was going to pick up at the point when you get captured and you have to escape, but I thought wrong. It was extremely weak as it was the same thing as before except in a building. At this point, I seriously considered about quitting the game, but I had the slightest sliver of hope that the game was going to be interesting, but once again... I was wrong. After being weaponless for an amount of time, you find a hammer. It's similar to the Crowbar in Half Life, mechanics-wise. After coming into a storage room, I see one of the clone-zombies as I like to call them because they all look the same. I snuck up behind it thinking that I could perform some heavy/stealth attack that would one-hit kill the zombie, but no! It recognized I was there, and I had to whack it repeatidly up close to kill it. This continued on for some time until I found this dude who looked like Dr. Kliner from Half Life 2. I had to free him from being locked up, and then I found the SMG from Half Life 2. I thought I could weild multiple weapons in an inventory, but sadly I wasn't able to. It turns out that you can carry only one weapon at a time. (Which sucks) The gun had loads of ammo crates by it, which seemed to be an insane amount of ammunition that I thought wasn't necessary. After that, you get separated, and you find yourself eventually in a warehouse. You turn a corner and then you find about three enemy NPC's shooting at you. If you kill them, you turn another corner, low on health (Trust me), and then you go into this cramped little hall. In there were about FOUR ENEMIES WITH MACHINE GUNS SHOOTING AT ME WITH NO CHANCE TO REACT! I tried again and again, and I was able to pick off one or two of them without dying, but It was virtualy impossible without something like a grenade to clear out the hall. After that, I immediately shut down the game, finally fed up with the horrible gameplay, impossible fights at this part, and overall, I felt like I wasted forty five minutes of my life. I DO NOT RECCOMEND THIS BLAND, MOD THAT IS NOT FUN OR ENJOYABLE WHATSOEVER!

												A bland walk through some very non-unique scenery. This is like a very small piece of Half Life 2 without the sci-fi elements. And story, what story, there is about none. A fisherman shipwrecks on some island that has some corporation and zombies. Could it be any more cliched and boring? Music is okay and graphics about on par with HL2, no surprise there as it uses mostly HL2 assets. Thankfully this is free, I would have been angry if I had paid for this. There is nothing wrong per se (well, the melee combat is somehow clumsy), it is just an uninspired piece of lack of imagination.

content:
Posted: February 20, 2014
												I read about Estranged: Act 1 on PC Gamer and their writing peaked my interest so I came and downloaded it right away. After a short wait time, it was finished and I fired it up. The first 10 minutes of the game oozed with atmosphere and style. It was very dark and eerie. I was excited to play more!And then...you start the most generic, uninspired "crawl through sewers" segment I've experienced in video gaming. I cant stress how uninspired this was. Quickly after that I realized how uninspired the whole game was. From Half Life 2 models to the generic "zombies" and mandatory bad-humans-in-disaster-situation, the game quickly turned into a chore. Pros: The beginning was nice, very atmospheric. The voice acting is superb and in some places the level design is very nice.Cons: Very generic story with a very generic and boring gameplay. Overall a very unispired standalone mod.Do I reccomend it? No, there are better Source mods out there.

number of helpful: 20 of 44 people (45%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 21, 2014
												I have to say I was a little disappointed with Estranged; Act I. From the screenshots, I was expecting a more story driven atmospheric experience. What I got, was a bunch of typical Source engine gameplay elements. Put a crate there so you can jump over stuff. Find a brick to throw through a window. Insert plug here, add switch there, talk to HL2 character models and use HL2 weapons to shoot other HL2 models. The story and atmosphere start out great, but are then just left out for most of the game as you work your way through boring levels battling enemies with really outdated combat mechanics (it feels worse than HL2 itself). Obviously it's free, so you can't complain about that, but at this point I wouldn't even invest the time to be honest.

content:
Posted: January 17, 2014
												+ Some of the most beautifully lighted sewers I have ever seen.- The story and gameplay are♥♥♥♥♥♥ It starts off as some kind of zombie apocalypse island survivor thing with a desolate abandoned atmosphere. You meet a guy who's been hiding in a cabin for weeks apparently, and he gives you his only gun for some reason. Then you do some lever pulling puzzles in a train yard for some reason. The mod takes it's time letting you walk around in a bunch of abandoned areas before throwing it's lame zombies at you, so there's a sense of build-up. Overall, the part where nothing is happening yet is the best part of the mod.You then somehow end up in an evil corporation office building staffed by the Half Life 2 rebel models who are trying to shoot you. You escape from the place with Dr. Kleiner who is under the alias "George Richmond".  (They could have at least given him a mustache and a toupee) Then there's a bunch of clumsy shootout sequences with the rebel modes, and you mess around with the Half Life 2 crane thing, and then you'll quit out of boredom.The player character is a fisherman who crashes his boat in the intro sequence. This doesn't seem to have any relevance to anything else that's going on, you don't even get to hit zombies with a fishing rod or anything. Nothing really relates to anything; it's just stuff happening.If you like pretty lighting then this is the mod for you.

content:
Posted: March 2, 2014
												Night, crash washed ashore, empty island, zombies, outbreak from research center... Aren't you bored already? Seriously, could they get any more generic?First mod hopelessly tries to be a horror, then corridor running sim and becomes crаp shooter towards end, they borrowed idea of finite flashlight from Afraid of Monsters but showered player with batteries and forgot to make it useful., sometimes mod gives you "puzzles", I called them puzzles in case HL2 puzzled you.Levels look like what you'd expect from HL2, not that it's a bad thing for a mod, but nevertheless it is so.I do not understand what's it doing on steam, of course it's not the worst mod I've played, seen worse, seen better, but why'd you play something average? At least when you play something bad you can have a laugh, but this... If you want proper HL2 horror mod, go get awesome Nightmare House 2 or Grey.I've recently played Train made by one man and I had much better experience with it.

												gameplay rating: quite boring and wasnt planned out very wellgraphics rating: very goodatmosphere: ok ish.....detail: well madeHello this is death_squared here making a review on this half life 2 mod recently came out i do say the environment nd detail is pretty well done but a few things i really isliked was the amount of battery power you would get fr your flashlight was not good enough a full battery would last about a minute before it would go out and everywhere you go was too ark and you needed your flashlight on every second of they way to know where you were going the right way or not and the batterys would last at least a few days inreal life i know they tried to make it realistic and all but they made the battery power too short and i couldnt finish the game like that and another thing i HATED..... through the whole game the ammo boxes were quite large but it would only have 8 rounds in it and even worse you get a melee weapon halfway through the game instead of the first weapon you get but it was the pistol you first get i really hated this because you could of saved lots rounds for your gun the voice acting was good but not entirely fit for the character models graphics were impressive now for conclusion                                                                             4/10 will not do...........

content:
Posted: March 2, 2014
												Night, crash washed ashore, empty island, zombies, outbreak from research center... Aren't you bored already? Seriously, could they get any more generic?First mod hopelessly tries to be a horror, then corridor running sim and becomes crаp shooter towards end, they borrowed idea of finite flashlight from Afraid of Monsters but showered player with batteries and forgot to make it useful., sometimes mod gives you "puzzles", I called them puzzles in case HL2 puzzled you.Levels look like what you'd expect from HL2, not that it's a bad thing for a mod, but nevertheless it is so.I do not understand what's it doing on steam, of course it's not the worst mod I've played, seen worse, seen better, but why'd you play something average? At least when you play something bad you can have a laugh, but this... If you want proper HL2 horror mod, go get awesome Nightmare House 2 or Grey.I've recently played Train made by one man and I had much better experience with it.

												At the beginning i was convinced that the game would be awesome. But after a while it just got annoying and i just ran and and shot everyone. I think for gamer who have never played an horror game, it is a good game to begin with, with some cool eastereggs. But for veteran player, who search for a unique horror experience, it is not the game they should go for.The game is like any other mod. But i have to say that they clearly put work in this mod. And i appreciate that they did that. But this was not what i was looking for. I expected more horror, more scares, maybe a good chase scene, or something like that. But what i got was some Zombies behind the corner, some of them got reanimated and attacked me etc. But none of that was that scary...The story wasn't anything new as far as I'm concerned. Don't want to spoil anything, so i cant really tell about the story.TL;DR : New at horror games ? - Go for it.            Are you not ? - Do not.            Do you search for an unique story line which is gripping ? - Not what you are searching for.

Not everything is an original asset (hence my usage of mod instead of game by itself since there's a clear distinction between a mod and something that happens to use Source) but there is still a fair amount of new content. If that doesn't want you to play it automatically I don't know what will. I did a full playthrough of it here.

content:
Posted: January 18, 2014
												A remarkably mediocre mod. The gameplay is a long and bland tunnel (Valve games tend to do this, but they try to provide some illusion that it's not just a path of corridors you follow.) The puzzles are easy, simple, uninspired, and take pages directly from Half Life 2, the plot is stereotypical, the zombies are buggy and silly, and overall the game underdelivers. The plot goes nowhere noteworthy, but that's ok because I expect nothing of it other than "we're scientists, we messed up and created zombies, now there's a containment conspiracy," and the game's finished in about an hour and a half. I suggest you don't waste your time playing this.

number of helpful: 62 of 131 people (47%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 18, 2014
												Estranged: Act 1 is the first installment of what is to be a continued series built on Valve's Source engine, and for a free mod built on an outdated engine it was quite impressive.Don't read too much into "impressive". What I mean is that the world and atmosphere of Estranged are wonderful and you feel like something terrifying can happen at any moment, which sadly doesn't happen. I found the build-up for confrontations to be a bit of a let-down, you're exploring an abandoned island that shows signs of recent struggle after being shipwrecked when you encounter the cause...Zombies.Yes, it is another Source zombie mod, which I found to be quite the letdown when I first encountered the enemy of the first half of the mod. Since this is the first installment of Estranged I overlooked the fact that there was no exposition to the background of the "outbreak" (which I'm reluctant to refer to as, since the zombies were few in number and were generally underwhelming in combat) and soldiered on through its three chapters. About halfway through you encounter the second enemy, which are gun-toting Half-Life 2 citizens that, also like the zombies, left a bit to be admired.With such a well-built atmosphere it was all the more disappointing to observe the lack of effort in the character models, even going as far to recycle Dr. Kliener's model. If you're a veteren of the Source engine then this method of re-using content will deal a large chunk of damage to any immersion, which for a mod that aims for atmosphere is not a good thing at all.The level design was very restrictive with almost no potential for exploration or discovery. The pacing was just messy inconsistently jumping from long winded and empty hallways to short and cramped office spaces. The puzzles are just horribly easy and the only way to fail them is if you suffered head trauma as a child. Overall the gameplay in both combat and level design was rubbish in laymans terms. The story is lacking and failed to grab my interest, but since this was only Act 1 I'm willing to overlook that and give the developers the benefit of the doubt and assume that more exposition will be given in the future installments.Now I may be giving Estranged a bit of a harsh lashing, and my expectations may have been a bit high for a free mod, but I just felt underwhelmed by the whole experience and I left Estranged very disappointed because of the apparant lack of effort in the character models and the combat. If Estranged cost any money then I would be much more harsh, but since it is a free mod with low memory and hardware requirements there really isn't any legitimate reason to not play through it for yourself and develop your own opinion about it. Who knows? You may just like what you see.The music was pretty good though.

number of helpful: 8 of 20 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 17, 2014
												A relentlessly bland game that doesn't have a single original idea in it, offering instead a endless barrage of zombie cliches while providing little to nothing in the way of scares, challenge, story, or fun. If a game is about what you do most often while playing it, Estranged: Act I is about walking down corridors while feeling bored. The entire game is a linear path from one vague objective to another. Once in a while you encounter either a single zombie, a first-person jumping puzzle (ugh), or some simple setpiece puzzle resolved in thirty seconds, at most. Enemies are so non-threatening and so few in number that any attempt to build tension falls flat, and the plot might as well not exist, utterly failing to tell an interesting story or give us characters that we connect with. The second half of the game starts ripping off Half-Life blatantly. There's a escort mission where you help a scientist who can open security doors get around an office complex, then you switch from bashing and shooting zombies to gunning down dudes with assault rifles who are trying to cover up the evil corporation's responsibility. Near the end the game shamelessly recycles the crane from Half-Life 2. Don't bother with Estranged, there are much better games out there.  Even if you're restricted to free games, the mod-turned-standalone Cry of Fear is light-years ahead of this poorly-executed boilerplate dross.

content:
Posted: January 21, 2014
												Estranged Act I is an example of a good singleplayer mod by the name of Alan Edwardes (correct me if i  misspelled his name) and it's almost a NMRiH+L4D crossover. Here is my opinions so far:Good Storyline: Your a fisherman who is stranded on a island infested by ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of ZAWMBES that will run at your face and beat the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of you. But it's not the zombies is your enemies, also the guys that want you to die will shoot you until you die, despite that your not infected. But the story would be a lot better if it makes sense (or it was just me who doesn't make any sense)A.I Director: The author of this mod probably added the A.I Director so he wouldn't place every ammo in a single map like he did in the Alpha versions. Probably an excellent way for a zombie apocalyptic themed mod.Zombies: They're just like your playing Left 4 Dead but no SI. They will jump high if you stay at the stairs for too long (confirmed in the barricade sequence) and shoot them in the head for a insta-kill. Shooting them in the chest or the legs will end up wasting your own ammo.Weapons: They sound very realistic for my taste, and that gold Colt 1911 is way too good for a mod like this. I won't explain a lot in this thing. Too much shooting to do.Also Alan, you didn'nt know you can carry more pistol ammo in the game than the traditional 80 (confirmed by playing Noamztunnels), but instead here's a note, try limiting the ammo about like 40 but that's just my only flaw in the game. But I still like it thoughRatings:PROSGood StorylineAI DirectorNice SoundtrackThe Pistol looks too goodThe ZombiesCONSSecond Half can get tedious and boring.Human AI is basically a copypaste from the dumb HL2 Rebel AI.OVERALL SCORE: 82/100

												TOO LITTLE TOO LATE. The age of sourcemods is coming to an end, and this one doesn't do anything Half-Life 2 didn't do way better. Zombies are not scary and die extremely easily, graphics are source engine, "puzzles" are way too simple, and the story is uh... I don't know even know what the story is supposed to be. Something about some evil corporation taking over some island and being jerks and probably making zombies, and there's some d00d with a wife and kid I'm supposed to care about or something I don't even know if that comes up again, I only played half an hour (got to the part ARQUE captures you and you escape).Maybe if I played this 5 years ago I would find the atmosphere engaging, but here in 2014 I'm too busy bhopping to care about the "jumpscares". Seriously, zombies pretending to be "sleeping" in obvious locations got predictable in Half-Life 2, did the makers of this think it would become scary here?

number of helpful: 0 of 4 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 15, 2014
												Well the mod presented itself in a way that I expected a high quality mod. What I got is a mod which wanted to be so much, but was nothing of that. The beginning was nice, but the same formula as 1000 other games and mods which is okay, but something more original would be nice. The graphics are really good for a Half-Life 2 Mod, but they get worse later in the game. Feels like they only put much effort into the beginning so it looks good in the trailers...This mod involves a lot of walking, A LOT, which is supposed to be atmosspheric or something, but i was boring. There is no exploration at all, because there is nothing to find, and the enviroments are all generic and get more and more generic with time. Also the borders of the levels were most of the time really obvious and they used the same method multiple times. Also in many places the game doesnt let you go back, a door shuts down or a something falls apart or I dont know, like a casual military shooter kinda.The gunplay was by far the most terrible gunplay ever Ive seen in a HL2 mod (probably because most mods use the gunplay of HL2 anyway which is fantastic). The enemys are so extremely dull, stupid, predictable and easy to kill. Just one shot to the head, wow. Where is the challenge? I mean they arent even really fast and they run straight to you. No skill involved in this game. Oh and btw the zombies look stupid and have stupid animations (which is okay considering its a mod).You can only hold one gun at a time which is probably supposed to feel realisitc, but I want fun games, not realistic games. Dont get me wrong, having only 1 gun could be fun, they just pulled it off terrible. It feeled like I had infinite ammo, cause everyone died with 1 shot anyway.Well, I hoped at least the puzzles could be fun, but no. They have extremely obvious solutions, mostly because they just use puzzles which were already in Half-Life 2 and even Half-Life 1. I was just doing what I had to do to progress, it feeled kinda lika QTEs where you just do what the game tells you to do.The voice acting was really good for a mod, but the humour was stupid. The game wanted to be funny, but the jokes were obvious or just bad.The part with the hammer was the most stupid, cause most zombies you encounter were lying on the ground, so you could easily kill them before they stand up. One area of the game was like 1by1 copied from Mirrors Edge, which is okay, just wanted to point it out.Overall the game was boring, and it felt like it wanted to do so much, but did everything bad. Instead they should focus on less things and makes those very good. It is just broken in so many ways, just designed bad. I stopped playing at the part with the cat. I know I am really harsh, but as I said the mod presented itself in a way that I had high expectations and not even the visuals could keep up with that.

number of helpful: 25 of 56 people (45%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 20, 2014
												Let down, the Official video game.Yesterday night, I watched the trailer, and it looked rather good for a mod. Today, I download it, and give it a try. And well, I wanted to give it a try, but it was too short, I finished the game in 2 hours. And I was trying to explore, and not rush it. So, let's explain why this mod fails.First of all, the game feels just like Final Fantasy XIII : It's a giant corridor. You can't do anything but to go forward, and well, in games like these it's okay, but also placing items that make wasting time exploring and piling up boxes be worth it. Does this mod do that? No. I've spend like 20 minutes of those 2 hours trying to find cool and hidden stuff, and got nothing. That's lazy. I have even got all the achievements (only 8 of them) on my first play, without really trying. The only one that could been difficult to find would be the one about a zombie watching a TV, but since I was actually looking for hidden crap, it was not hard at all. THe game is pretty much filled with locked doors you can't open, and it forces you to keep going forward, ignoring the work that was put into the mod.And talk about lazy, the story. It kind of fails to deliver. You expect something BIG to happen, and you get nothing. You lose, good day sir. The story is not interesting, but to be fair, there's almost no story at all. And you know what's even worse than that? Zombies. Yeah, motherf#cking zombies. I'm tired of seeing zombies in games, but this is just dumb. For some reason, there are zombies in this island. The game gives NO explanation of WHY THE HELL THERE ARE ZOMBIES RUNNING ARROUND EVERYWHERE. But of course, then you find humans who try to kill you for reasons also unknown. And what's this? The game seems to be split into multiple episodes. Why not just work into a full mod and release it at once, instead of giving the people an unfinished game?Most of the models NPC's have are either the same from Half Life 2 with minor changes, or custom, made by the creators, but with...strange animations. The guy who gives you a pistol at the start of the game isn't even holding it right, zombies have hillarious attack animations...Stuff like that.There has been a lot of work with the mod, that's for sure. But if I had to rate the entire game by this first part, it would get the same rating I would give to most generic shooters we all get every now and then (You know, Call of Duty, Battlefield...). Like a 3 or 4 /10. The voice acting is good, the music is really amazing, but the rest is...Well, less than average.And seriously, cats? Why the hell is the Internet so filled with cats? Why not parrots? Or zebras? Or dinosaurs with afro hair?Oh, and the game seems to crash when you try to check the game options while in the game, in the pause menu. It crashed twice, and made me waste even more time. I can tell you, you can finish this game in one hour, or less.Edit: Oh wow, you know what's more dissapointing? The creators of the game making reviews of their own creation, giving it 10/10 and saying it's perfect in every way possible. It's not even finished, how can it be perfect!?

number of helpful: 1 of 9 people (11%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 1, 2016
												I've downloaded this game because it had a lot, generally positive review.I think it's a very "thin" game, and I don't recommend it.The problem is that it feels more like a technical exercise than a game.It fails as an action game, as the fighting itself is very limited; there is no strategy or variety.It also fails as an expressive medium, as there is no real story; only a very generic and derivative plot (corporation X caused a zombie outbreak and it's covering it up). The characters are paper-thin and purely functional; the locations are quite interesting, but again, there is no depth; the puzzles are [very often] of the type "stack the boxes" or "push the lever and disable the electricity".The game has a very distinct Half life 2 feeling. It's not about the engine though; it's about the game as a whole: it feels very much 2004; even the name is a reference to it. People who enjoy retrogaming may like it, but by today's standards, it would have been much more effective to make a shorter but deeper game, than a longer and shallower one.Based on the website informations, the creators seem more technically than artistically minded - I think they're not going into an interesting direction with the Act 2, which I'll likely not play.

Posted: June 16, 2014
												I will freely express that this is a wonderful, well-made mod. I did not run into any bugs, so playthrough was clean and not at all frustrating. The puzzles are intuitive and creative (although rather few in number), the music is fresh and fitting, and the voice acting is very well done. I felt immersed in the game, and the environments were detailed and fun to explore. Where I needed to go was well marked, so I never truly felt lost. I got a bit worried about my ammunition though, and at one point I ran out, but I was able to outrun the enemies, and generally the item spacing made sense.The story could use some development, perhaps more than just the one newspaper for background, but I will wait to pass judgment until the other Acts are released. Generally, I'm interested to see how the story unfolds. I was also pleased with the length of the mod, all things considered--I put in about 1.5 hours, but was expecting much shorter. Overall, I feel this mod has a little bit of everything that makes for a satisfying playthrough, and would highly recommend it. What have you got to lose?

Posted: January 22, 2014
												Well, this was a bit of a mixed bag.The atmosphere is nice, level design and voice acting are quite impressive for a free mod, and it does pull you in at the start. But it's problem is it's trying to do too much. The start of the game seems to be going for an Amnesia-like feel, but then it switches to jump scares and full shootouts as you progress.Pros:Game world feels real and believableVoice actingExcellent musicMulti platform, Linux version runs without any problemsCons:Rather cliche story, though atmosphere makes up for some of itTries to do too much, resulting in rather large shifts in gameplay styleNot passing any judgments on graphics since I played it on my laptop using integrated Intel card. It ran well without much fiddling with settings, so that's a plus.Overall, I'd say give it a go. It's rather short and easy on normal difficulty so there's not much you can lose.And seriously, release the soundtrack, it's easily my favorite part of the game.

Posted: February 5, 2014
												In Estranged Act 1, the starting sequence can be a little confusing, however, that problem is quickly solved as you are thrown from your boat and into the water, though there was no indication that you are a fisherman until later when other characters refer to you as a fisherman. Story As said before Estranged Act 1 has you experiencing a ship crash which results in your being stranded on an island. At first, you might not even see this game as scary, much less a zombie game, in fact I had no idea that this was a zombie game at all when i first started playing the game. After meeting a man named John who gives you a gun and sets you on your way, your real goal is unclear. The game progesses in a fasion of your moving forward and finding your way around obstacles until you are knocked out by a long fall and captured. When you awake you are tied to a chair and interrogated, which leads to the game resuming the "move forward" gameplay. This continues until you arrive at Arque Corporation, a company mentioned in the beggining portion of the game. There, you meet a doctor (who you immediately trust?) who wants to find a way to send a message for help off the island. After failing at this task due to a signal disruption coming from the other side of the island you part ways. Afterwards, Arque Corporation is alerted to your presence and you must fight your way out. After escaping, you come to a cabin which leaves you on a very big cliffhanger for Act 2. Playability If you are using a control, you might be something of a trailblazer here, as the game gives you no help as far as controls go on a controller. All control hints are made with a computer in mind, which would make sense seeing as this game is on a computer based game store. As you progress through the game you get the hang of the controls which are similar to Half Life 2 (it is a mod of Half Life 2 after all) or, if you are not familiar with it, like other mods of Half Life 2 i.e. No More Room in Hell. The only complaint I have is the fact that you can't aim down the sights, making aiming difficult, and causing an unneccesary loss of bullets as you take multiple shots to down one zombie. But, as with the rest of the controls, aiming gets easier and I saw myself downing zombie with one simple headshot again.GraphicsAs with the controls, graphics are similar to higher quality mods of Half Life 2. I saw improvements in water effects, as well as shadows being darker and displaying a true sense of the absence of light when zombies would run out of it straight towards you. This carries over to lighting effects, with light being essential to the game unless you turn the brightness up, which makes getting the Estranged in the Dark acheivement a challenge. Depth of view effects were a nice touch, though there are small problems with it. One small problem I saw, was how your vision would still be blurred after opening a door, until being quickly adjusted. Again, a small problem, but it can't be overlooked. CharactersWhat few notable character there are in this game are boring without having a real backstory to them. Voice acting can sometimes seem unrealistic, as some voices are not getting their desired effect. John for example may have been trying to sound like he was truly affected emotionally by the strange disapearence of his wife and daughter, but instead sounded like he was trying to hold back a laugh. Characters also don't seem to react too much to transpiring events. John again, for example, shoots (a zombie as you later find out) someone in plain view of you. After you go up to him he acts like nothing happened at all, he doesn't try to explain the situation either. I for one would probably not trust someone who just fired a round into someone's head. Sound EffectsMusic play a key role in the beginning of the game, though its fades as you get deeper into it, as music changed when you enter a new room for example. The music definetely does scare you with it's creepy effects, as it made me think that something was just around the corner. Battle music always feels right as well as a kind of chase scene. Gun sounds are farily realistic, as well as splash and breaking glass sound effects. ReplayabilityWith the challenge of acheivements always present, I could definetely see myself playing the game one or two more times, though anymore would be pushing it. The reason for this is that you come to expect and memorize where zombies are as oppose to when you first play the game through. Wrap Up Estranged Act 1 is a perfect example of the thought that games don't have to be made by enormous corporations, or be extremely taxing to your PC to be good. A zombie shooter with touches of horror as well, I would definetely recommend playing through at least once, to get the feel of what it means to be estranged. Story: 9.7/10 Well thought out with very little questionable partsPlayability: 7/10 Easy to learn controls, however no aiming down sights?Graphics:  9/10 Impressive graphics for games like this; Depth of view issuesCharacters: 4/10 Uninteresting characters with little emotion and unrealistic voice tonesSound Effects: 9.5/10 Musical horror effects start out strong but fade out later in the game, other music always fits the moodReplayability: 9/10 Acheivements offer multiple playthroughs as well as new challengesOverall Score: 48.2/60

Posted: February 28, 2016
												Estranged Act I is the first part in an action fps horror survival game. You play as a fisherman with no memory of anything shipwrecked on a mysterious civilian island. This game at first scared the living♥♥♥♥♥♥out of me as doors would close randomly and creatures and people would come out of nowhere and attack me. This game is mostly a mystery game with puzzles closely related to the hal life games. Obviously like the HL games this game is mostly based off scripted events that happen. The game though is not a horror game it does not hav that many jumpscares and does not have a lot of enemies thrown at you. During the first levels you are trying to figure out whats happening and get your hands on a gun pretty early but with not much ammo. Once you get the pistol zombies start to spawn in certain locations and you eventually find a place that might explain what happened. Not to spoil anything but near the end of the game you get your hands on more ammo and guns and for the first time confronted by human enemies. Overall as a free game this is worth buying even if its only about 1-2 hours long it still is a brief yet fun experience.

Posted: April 24, 2014
												"Estranged Act I" What an awesome free game. My first thought was that a free game must be mediocre at best, but no, this game is freaking amazing. Originally a Half Life 2 mod, this game is a first person adventure with shooting, interacting with your environment, and puzzle solving. I don't want to ruin your (very short) experience by saying... well anything... about it. The story develops in the best possible way, it reveals what's going on around you with little hints and scraps of newspapers laying on the ground, and subtle offhanded comments that the few characters in the game sneak in.The game won't give you a suggestion of what to do to move on, if you get stuck you're generally in a limited space with few objects, the tone of the game is "figure it out or give up". I like this, since there aren't any overly challenging points unless you've never played any first person game ever, in which case, you'll still certainly figure it out. The storyline and the consistent pace make for a super enjoyable evening. When you finish, you'll be satisfied, you'll have laughed,♥♥♥♥♥♥your pants, and probably smacked yourself in the forehead for taking too long to figure out an easy puzzle. My only message to you if you are going to play this game, without spoilers of course, is to please, please, read everything, click on everything, get the achievement for the cats! (You'll know it when you get it.)Overall: 10/10 (Best FPS experience in a long, long time.)

Posted: July 20, 2014
												It is hard to call this a mod for hl2 because it looks nothing like anything in the half-life series. Most of these mods have only zombies, only soldiers, or they take place in the half-life universe. Considering they reused Dr. Kliener's model, I don't think it takes place in the half-life universe. The gameplay isn't anything like hl2, either. Now you need batteries for your flashlight, you can hold multiple batteries, there is no armour, you can only carry one weapon at a time, you can read emails and newspapers, usefull things glow when you are near them(can be turned off in options), you can disable your HUD and crosshair, and your weapons make you so OP that the devil has nightmares about you. Through the game, your one-shot-kill pistol becomes a three-shot-kill hammer, which later becomes a five-shot-kill SMG. Also, it's never explained why you start fighting people. I don't understand how you go from fighting only zombies at night to fighting only people in the daytime. Still, it's better than Half-Life 2: Episode 2, so I reccomend it.

												The experience is great; it includes immersive gameplay and scenery, along with a whip of action, mystery, and horror. It fulfills it's title of a horror adventure, with a deepening plot as you go along with the game. Estranged: Act 1 is a great start and is full of potential to keep it's momentum going. It includes things that are unique among other source stories; and includes a level of interactivity not seen in most stories of this genre.If you like a story that stands out from the rest, I suggest you give this a try.

Posted: January 25, 2014
												Estranged: Act I was a weird experience and left me feeling unsettled throughout and kept me finishing it in one session, however weird does not always mean bad. I went into this without high expectations and as I awoke shipwrecked on an island, desolate of life, yet full of detail, I started wanting to explore it and the reason behind my being here. Soon after followed the first gunshots and a chance meeting with a stranger, which would eventually lead to an even bigger mistery and to my morale downfall.After having played through this I am able to tell you, the people who created this have made an astonishing game alongside a good story, making you question your actions. Though there are some minor issues regarding the overall top-notch level design, which can be seen in the train session, but otherwise the few puzzles in the game are mostly straight forward, however still have you involved in the actual gameplay.Something funny before I conclude my review:At one point you enter a room, well a space which reminded me of one of my favourite games 'Mirror's Edge', well this will probably mislead many people, however it added to my overall enjoyment.Thank you for creating this free to play game and I hope that I can see a continuation of this in the future.

Posted: January 25, 2014
												Estranged: Act I is a Half Life 2 mod that uses the Source engine and plays like Half Life 2 but doesn't relate to HL2's story in any way. I think I noticed one character that seemed familiar from the Half Life universe but I am not 100% sure it was him. This game is free so I thought to install and give it a try. For a free to play game it is pretty decent and can be completed in one sitting.The story of the game is simple. You are a shipwrecked fisherman who is stranded on a strange and mysterious island and is trying to find his path back onto the mainland and recontact civilization. However, during the course of your adventures you encounter hostile and dangerous being, a corrupt organization with a bad agenda and very little of normal civilization.As soon as the game starts the atmosphere really does pull you into the story and you are immersed into a universe that both intrigues and occasionally and creeps you out. The game isn't a challenging one with the enemies being very easy to defeat. The game is meant to be played for the immersion and exploration which are two elements the game achieves well from the outset but it seems to weaken a bit as you progress. The start of the game is a little slow going but it's one of those games that gets better as you play through it. There are a small number of weapons and tools at your disposal such as  a pistol, SMG, torch, and medkit. The first Act is short-lived and forgettable but is a good experience which is further improved by the fact that it is free. I was mildly dissapointed by the ending which seemed rushed but nonetheless I am looking forward to Act II whenever it is coming out. Let's hope Act II is also free.

Posted: February 4, 2014
												CONCLUSION AT THE END!Let's first start off with: it's free, so why not give it a shot?This game does not feel like it's free, it feels like a whole game, even though it's not that long. It has many elements that HL2 has too, sometimes positive, sometimes negative. It is a very enjoyable shooter and the atmosphere is very good and fits the whole situation: you're stranded on an unknown island and you have to survive the zombies. I find it a little disappointing they chose for zombies, because there are a lot of zombie games out there and it would be nice to have some other enemy for once. The story is pretty good overall and the voice acting is also good.Things I'd like to see in Act II:-Other enemies, not just zombies and bandits;-More things customized, this means more models, weapons and maybe props;-Better melee combat;-Higher difficulty at some points.Pros:-Appealing story;-Good shooter elements;-Good voice acting;-Amazing atmosphere;-Achievements (for the achievement hunters);-Overall fun gameplay.-IT'S FREE!Cons:-Your typical enemies, zombies and bandits;-Not many weapons;-AI too good at some points;Conclusion:Get this game right now, it's free, small in file size and you'll have a great experience playing it!

Posted: January 23, 2014
												This game was suprisingly in depth for a free to play game. Unlike other zombie games, Estranged:Act I does a great job implementing both survival and FPS. In general I would rate 7/10 and here is why.The Characters:There was some interesting character devolpment from the begining. You meet random strangers who live on this island each either hindering or benefitting you. In an actual apocolypse it really will be  a matter of deciding whether or not someone is a freind or a foe. The Hero:To be blunt, the hero is pretty uninteresting untill he picks up a gun. Becuase, you know that the run of the mill fisherman actually can use guns. Even though the hero's backstory is kind of vague, it does feel more emmersive than if there was more. You were on a ship. You crashed. Now survive. The zombies:Unfortunatly, the zombies are why I didn't rate 9/10. They weren't that intimidating. If an object is in front of a zombie the first thing they do is throw it at you, even if its just a book. If a window is broken you would think they would try to jump at you or climb through. Nope. They just stand there as you engage in extreme staring contests. Half of the zombies you can just walk up to them crack their skulls. After a while, the game stops being about surviving and just becomes a pure FPS.The Gameplay: Between the puzzles and the stealth, not only do you have to think quick but you have to be resourceful. A lot of the game I was avoiding using my gun to perserve bullets. If you don't manage to find more ammo your helpless. In Exchange for a small amount of bullets, there are several diffrent traps you can set up to sweep out pesky zombies. if you like problem solving and surviving thenn you will like this game.Environment:There are a few bugs with the texturing leaving either white hairlines on things or red lines in water. The amount of areas to explore are very linear. Granted, I didn't expect a free roam Skyrim style world in the first place, but it would have been nice to have more than ammo or health packs for a reward for taking alternate paths. In Conclusion:It was a nice game, and I don't regret playing it. Overall it has potential for making me want to purchase the next game. The graphics were a little lower but the gameplay makes up for it. There were a lot of perks and I feel acomplished after making it to the next checkpoint. If you enjoy heart pounding, problem solving, well thought zombie games You will enjoy this title.

Posted: January 18, 2014
												Downloaded this not expecting much, but it's probably one of my favorite games right now. It's only a couple hours long, but those hours have been great.[minor spoilers below:]Basically, Estranged is a well-written love-letter to Half-Life 2: there's a shady corporation, hints that something went wrong, zombie-like creations, and a military-is-hunting-you deal. But where it really, really feels like Half-Life in a way I haven't seen done outside of Valve is the atmosphere. The music is amazing, especially for a free  game like this (minimalist orchestral parts, eerie electronic swells, pulsing bass), and the quiet exploration through Pacific-Northwest-style scenery was excellent. There is noise when there should be noise, but unlike most games, it isn't overly-cinematic. Walking around, solving basic puzzles felt incredibly quiet and natural. The actual game-mechanics still feel a bit blocky, and some sound-effects could use some work (your gun makes that early-90's video-game "pop" sound), but overall, I'm already looking forward to seeing Act II.

												你将扮演一名渔夫，你被困在一座与外界失去联系的岛屿上。而这座岛上发生了一场可怕的疫情，岛上一部分的人变成了僵尸。你的任务就是想办法与外界取得联系。游戏的画面感一般，背景音乐有点恐怖。游戏的真实性很强，游戏过程中不会给你任何路线提示。你可能会走投无路，但是你可以凭借你的智慧创造出一条路。你不会遇到僵尸群，只会有零散的僵尸出现。游戏很考验你的智慧与判断力，有点解密性质的游戏。本人已经把此章节完成，游戏还没有更新完，很是期待第二章节。You will play a fisherman, you are trapped on an island lost contact with the outside world. And on the island there was a terrible epidemic, the island became a part of people zombies. Your task is to find ways to get in touch with the outside world. The general sense of the game screen, the background music a little scary. Authenticity of the game is very strong, the game will not give you any route tips. You may be desperate, but you can rely on your wisdom to create a path. You will not encounter zombies, zombies will appear there scattered. The game is a test of your intelligence and common sense, a little decrypt the nature of the game. I've completed this chapter, the game has not finished updating, it is looking forward to the second chapter.

Posted: February 20, 2014
												The first thing that surprised me when I started playing Estranged was that it was free. I assumed it would be just another poor free Half Life Modification like Half Life Before. How wrong I was. Estranged turned out to be an atmospheric experience as terrifying as Amnesia in places. The growing feeling like something very wrong is going on here is always with you, and you never feel safe or alone. What I did enjoy was how well melded together amostphere and combat were, when I encoutered a group of infected, it was flight or fight. At this point, I chose flight. Running from the infected sounds stupid when you have bullets in your gun, because they die with one shot to the head. The infected are fast and agile however and you risk an awful lot when taking them head-on. The best thing about Estranged was the sound. The sound in this game was overwhelmingly good. Everything is crisp and clean. From the Echoing sound of my feet on a concrete floor in an incredibly uncomfortably close quators sewer system, to the flickering of a broken light, to the snarling of the infected. This game is an all around winner.For a free game, I highly reccomend Estranged. Just remember to play it with the lights off and a pair of head phones, and you'll be looking for an exscuse to stop playing, because its so damn scary.

Posted: February 5, 2014
												In Estranged Act 1, the starting sequence can be a little confusing, however, that problem is quickly solved as you are thrown from your boat and into the water, though there was no indication that you are a fisherman until later when other characters refer to you as a fisherman. Story As said before Estranged Act 1 has you experiencing a ship crash which results in your being stranded on an island. At first, you might not even see this game as scary, much less a zombie game, in fact I had no idea that this was a zombie game at all when i first started playing the game. After meeting a man named John who gives you a gun and sets you on your way, your real goal is unclear. The game progesses in a fasion of your moving forward and finding your way around obstacles until you are knocked out by a long fall and captured. When you awake you are tied to a chair and interrogated, which leads to the game resuming the "move forward" gameplay. This continues until you arrive at Arque Corporation, a company mentioned in the beggining portion of the game. There, you meet a doctor (who you immediately trust?) who wants to find a way to send a message for help off the island. After failing at this task due to a signal disruption coming from the other side of the island you part ways. Afterwards, Arque Corporation is alerted to your presence and you must fight your way out. After escaping, you come to a cabin which leaves you on a very big cliffhanger for Act 2. Playability If you are using a control, you might be something of a trailblazer here, as the game gives you no help as far as controls go on a controller. All control hints are made with a computer in mind, which would make sense seeing as this game is on a computer based game store. As you progress through the game you get the hang of the controls which are similar to Half Life 2 (it is a mod of Half Life 2 after all) or, if you are not familiar with it, like other mods of Half Life 2 i.e. No More Room in Hell. The only complaint I have is the fact that you can't aim down the sights, making aiming difficult, and causing an unneccesary loss of bullets as you take multiple shots to down one zombie. But, as with the rest of the controls, aiming gets easier and I saw myself downing zombie with one simple headshot again.GraphicsAs with the controls, graphics are similar to higher quality mods of Half Life 2. I saw improvements in water effects, as well as shadows being darker and displaying a true sense of the absence of light when zombies would run out of it straight towards you. This carries over to lighting effects, with light being essential to the game unless you turn the brightness up, which makes getting the Estranged in the Dark acheivement a challenge. Depth of view effects were a nice touch, though there are small problems with it. One small problem I saw, was how your vision would still be blurred after opening a door, until being quickly adjusted. Again, a small problem, but it can't be overlooked. CharactersWhat few notable character there are in this game are boring without having a real backstory to them. Voice acting can sometimes seem unrealistic, as some voices are not getting their desired effect. John for example may have been trying to sound like he was truly affected emotionally by the strange disapearence of his wife and daughter, but instead sounded like he was trying to hold back a laugh. Characters also don't seem to react too much to transpiring events. John again, for example, shoots (a zombie as you later find out) someone in plain view of you. After you go up to him he acts like nothing happened at all, he doesn't try to explain the situation either. I for one would probably not trust someone who just fired a round into someone's head. Sound EffectsMusic play a key role in the beginning of the game, though its fades as you get deeper into it, as music changed when you enter a new room for example. The music definetely does scare you with it's creepy effects, as it made me think that something was just around the corner. Battle music always feels right as well as a kind of chase scene. Gun sounds are farily realistic, as well as splash and breaking glass sound effects. ReplayabilityWith the challenge of acheivements always present, I could definetely see myself playing the game one or two more times, though anymore would be pushing it. The reason for this is that you come to expect and memorize where zombies are as oppose to when you first play the game through. Wrap Up Estranged Act 1 is a perfect example of the thought that games don't have to be made by enormous corporations, or be extremely taxing to your PC to be good. A zombie shooter with touches of horror as well, I would definetely recommend playing through at least once, to get the feel of what it means to be estranged. Story: 9.7/10 Well thought out with very little questionable partsPlayability: 7/10 Easy to learn controls, however no aiming down sights?Graphics:  9/10 Impressive graphics for games like this; Depth of view issuesCharacters: 4/10 Uninteresting characters with little emotion and unrealistic voice tonesSound Effects: 9.5/10 Musical horror effects start out strong but fade out later in the game, other music always fits the moodReplayability: 9/10 Acheivements offer multiple playthroughs as well as new challengesOverall Score: 48.2/60

Posted: July 22, 2015
												Let me start off by saying that I am NOT and never have been a zombie game lover.  Also, when it comes to horror games, I almost never enjoy games in which you can defend yourself with some sort of firearm.  So, when I saw this game, I was in for a surprise.  Now, you probably think that I was dissapointed or disgusted with the game because it does in fact have both zombies and defensive gameplay, but somehow this game gave me entertainment and made me more and more interested in finishing it.  The atmosphere is pretty well made, and the story isn't the worst out there.  If you let youself get into this game, you'll hopefully become like me and keep pushing yourself to figure out what will happen next.Difficulty wasn't the worst.  I don't remember if there was a setting for difficulty because it's been a while since I played it, but I remember that I was only stuck on one scene, but only because I lacked common sense (We've all been there).Estranged Act 1 also isn't as scary as some of you may hope.  I probably had a heart pumping moment once or twice throughout the entire playthrough, but it certainly was very fun to play.If you enjoy the game as much as I did then I would predict that the ending will dissapoint you.  Not a disappointment that ruins the game for you, but a disppointment that the game is actually over and you have to wait for Act 2.  I know for a fact that when Estranged Act 2 comes out that I'll be playing it and will be writing a review for the Act as well.  If the producers keep most of the first game's aspects in the second release, I'm sure it'll do excellent and excel just like the first one did.So play it and see for yourself what a game with good graphics, story, and gameplay in general is like.  I doubt anyone will regret it.Fun Fact: This game was released on my birthday :)

Posted: January 19, 2014
												Estranged: Act I-----------------When I first downloaded this game, I was skeptical. Firstly, it was free: sure, they probably couldn't make it paid because it's a blatant HL2 Mod, but all legal aspects aside great quality shouldn't be expected in a free game. Secondly, I'd seen some of the reviews on the Estranged community page: "This mod sucks!" "No quality!" "I like cheese!". But what the hell, when did I listen to random people over the Internet? So I tried the game.Turns out, whoa, it isn't half bad. Spanning about an hour and a half, one can take comfort in the fact that future installments will give you an overall decent playtime. The environments are quite beautiful in places: an observant player might notice some props and textures from HL2, but there's plenty of custom materials in this game to give it a fairly unique feel. There's also a good soundtrack, which at one point made me super pumped and ready to kick some♥♥♥♥♥There's two kinds of enemy in this first act: firstly, dumb running zombies. They look more like hobos on some kind of drug, which is cool, because killing frenzied druggies is way better than killing headcrab zombies. They can even play dead sometimes, which gave me a jumpscare on two separate occasions. The second type of enemy is, more disappointingly, a HL2 rebel. Of course, this time they're hostile and flashlight-wielding, and actually quite a challenge to take down if you aren't well-equipped. Thankfully, these elite hostiles don't come into play until quite near the end.There's a fair few action sequences where you're gunning down whatever stands in your path, but also a lot of platforming and puzzle parts. The kind of structure that made HL2 a great game, I suppose. Running around in super tense situations before cooling down with a bit of crate-stacking and vent-crawling. There was never a moment when I wanted to quit because I got bored, and the shots just kept on coming.Overall, good game. Buy it. It's free, which is the best price ever. So no excuses.

Posted: January 19, 2014
												Estranged act I was a short, but amazing game, (well, part of a game) that left me very disappointed when i was finnaly met with the dredded "end credits". The dev. team did a magnificent job at taking the old source 2 engine and making something better out of it. I ofen found myself thinking, "This is a half life 2 mod, wow." while the graphics arent top of the line, i really did'nt care beacause its still a beautiful game and makes you realize th quality that you can get out of a small team and something to work with. Also the soundtack, AMAZING, the music would have you tense when turning a corner, and make you feel awesome when in a gunfight. Another thing to add to the list of things done right in this game is the voice acting, it was wonderful and the script was well written. My only complaint is the models you recycled from HL2, like dr kleiner or using the rebel models for the arque thugs, it just pulled me out of the experience. overall though it was a great experience, id even go as far as to say on of the best experiences you can get, FOR FREE, yes its free, just another reason to get the game. the best part is that the memory space and hardware requirements are very low. All in all, Estranged act I left me wanting more and i cant wait for act II

Posted: January 20, 2014
												Estranged: Act I, Where do I begin? This game is unlike many others, the atmosphere is thrilling, (this game is best played in a dark room), the gameplay is excellent, and the mystery behind it all. You are put alone, through a proverbial torment, a childs nighmare after watching a scary movie. Despite it's short length, Estranged: Act I has become one of my favourites to just sit down and play over and over. There is so much to explore and find this game is great. And the best part, its FREE.10/10I hope Estranged: Act II comes out soon.

Posted: December 15, 2014
												Estranged: Act 1, is an amazing mod for the HL2 engine that in roughly an hour managed to draw me into the environment and gameplay as effectively as Half-Life did the first time I played it. The atmosphere is great, and while the FPS elements are naturally laid on thick as per it being a HL2 mod, I actually found myself quite pleased with the amount of time the game took to build tension. It took it's time, didn't pull half the horror cheap-shots it set up for itself, and while the story isn't the most well-developed thing I've ever seen, I felt well emerged in the game. Overall, I would say it's worth the download if you have a craving for a short horror-action game that isn't resorting to the old indie hat of pixelated haunted houses. I can't wait to see what future installments could offer, and I would gladly pay for the next one, as the creators intend.

												Personal Rating: 8 out of 10.Despite that the graphics seem a bit dated, especially when it comes to the rendering the various enemies and npc's of the game, the storyline is what gets you. Not sure if I went through Chapters 2 and 3 during the course of the game, it did not say. If I didn't, I got quite a ways to go, but am still going to play it when acts 2 and 3 make their debut, just to see what the hell happens. The only real gripe is that when I played through this game, and needed to access a computer in-game or the options menu there was no mouse icon. BEWARE!!!, because you can still use your mouse to select items, the mouse arrow is invisible and you'll kinda have to move your mouse around until the option you want is highlighted.

												This game is excelent.  It has a briliant transition of styles; from horror to action.  The transiton between these styles is as briliant as Half-Life 2's.
